17 2021-07-19 eye disorder He actually woke up with vomiting/ he threw up; Couldn't walk for a week; The room was spinning and ... Read more
Close
He actually woke up with vomiting/ he threw up; Couldn't walk for a week; The room was spinning and he threw up; Rash over the body and it's on one side of the body right now the inside they're little balls, bubbles with some kind of puss inside, water or puss; Rash over the body and it's on one side of the body right now the inside they're little balls, bubbles with some kind of puss inside, water or puss; Not sure, we look at pictures they look like shingles; He has side effects on his left eye; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (parent). A 17-year-old male patient (reporter's son) received second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection) via an unspecified route of administration on 03Jul2021 at around 10 at night (at the age of 17-year-old) (Batch/Lot number was not reported) as single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The patient medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. Historical vaccine included received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection) via an unspecified route of administration on an unknown date (Batch/Lot number was not reported) as single dose for covid-19 immunization and did not experience any adverse event. Reporter stated, "my son had the Pfizer and he in the states right now and he went to play hockey, he took the second COVID on the next Saturday, he got it around 10 o clock in the night on 03Jul2021 and on 04Jul2021 he actually woke up with vomiting, could not walk for a week, the room was spinning and he threw up, I don't know if I said that and barely made a back to the bedroom, woke up had a rash over the body and it was on one side of the body right now the inside they were little balls, bubbles with some kind of puss inside, water or puss". The reporter also stated "not sure, we look at pictures they look like shingles, I see on the internet that in some rare cases it can be activate shingles in your body and I want to know how rare these side effects are and what to do about it". When confirmed that the vaccine son took was Pfizer COVID-19 Vaccine, reporter stated, yes, he was 17 and he had to take it. When probed anatomical site where vaccine was administered, reporter stated, I don't know that. I know that he has side effects on his left eye (on an unknown date in Jul2021). I don't know what side he got the injection. I would assume you got it in his left hand because he uses his right hand for lot of things". The outcome of the events was unknown. Information regarding the lot/batch number has been requested.

Close
Having seasonal allergies and it made them exponentially worse; Having seasonal allergies and it made them exponentially worse; Swollen tonsils; Pin inside ears; Swollen lymph nodes in my neck; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer, the patient. A 17-year-old male patient received the first dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot Number: UNKNOWN) via an unspecified route of administration in left arm on 31Mar2021 at 12:00 (at the age of 17-years-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included seasonal allergies which was ongoing. Concomitant medications were not reported. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. On 31Mar2021 at 19:00, after vaccination the patient's seasonal allergies became exponentially worse. The patient also experienced swollen lymph nodes in neck, swollen tonsils and pin inside ears. The events resulted in doctor/other healthcare professional office/clinic visit. The patient's doctor believed that the events were related to vaccine administration. The patient received treatment with steroid and other unspecified pain relief pills. The clinical outcome of the events vaccine made seasonal allergies exponentially worse, swollen lymph nodes in neck, swollen tonsils in neck and pin inside ears was not resolved at the time of this report. No follow-up attempts are needed; information about lot number cannot be obtained.

Close
Within minutes of shot, my son had a seizure. He complained of tingling in left arm, then he couldn?t hear anything and had blurred vision, and said he had an extreme headache. Within moments he began convulsions that became stronger and his whole body was shaking. This lasted for about 45 seconds. He stopped shaking and began to wake up. He was groggy and confused and said he didn?t remember anything, but the pain in his head subsided. 911 was called and they took him to the hospital to check his vitals. They could not be sure what brought on Seizure. Suggested Vagol Response. We went home. That evening he felt tingles and needles in body, we thought side affect of vaccine. Today, he was in extreme pain from pins and needles sensations throughout his body.

Close
tested positive for covid 19; lost sense of taste and smell; lost sense of taste and smell; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable other hcp. This other HCP reported for a 17-year-old male patient received bnt162b2 (BNT162B2, Pfizer-BioNTech Covid-19 mRNA Vaccine, Solution for injection, Batch/Lot EW0198), dose 1 intramuscular, administered in Arm Left on 13Jul2021 as DOSE 1, SINGLE for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included dust mite allergy. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. On 15Jul2021 (two days post vaccination) patient experienced tested positive for covid 19, lost sense of taste and smell. The patient underwent lab tests which included body temperature: normal, sars-cov-2 test: positive on 15Jul2021 (Covid 19 Ag card). Reporter seriousness for tested positive for covid 19 was not serious. received his first dose of Pfizer Covid vaccine. Reporter was wondering if that was to be expected. Second dose scheduled for 03Aug2021. Treatment declines any. He has no other symptoms, checked temperature and it was normal, sinuses and lungs are fine, no body aches. He is a healthy child, no conditions. There is a Product Complaint. Caller asking if these results mean the patient actually has Covid-19. Response: Spoke from "regulatory authority-can the vaccine cause a false positive COVID-19 test (v3.0)." "Viral tests are used to see if you have a current infection. The Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine will not cause you to test positive on viral tests. The following website has information on viral tests for current infection with COVID-19:# Sending email fulfillment containing attached document per caller request. Informed caller that the Pfizer BioNTech Covid-19 Vaccine cannot cause a Covid-19 infection. Informed caller that Pfizer cannot speak to the reliability of the results of the test used. The outcome for all events was unknown.

Close
Patient was nervous about getting vaccine. Discussed safety profile of vaccine and that many people are tolerating very well. Patient seemed much better after discussion and was ready to get vaccine. Gave injection and he was doing fine and went to sit down for 30 minutes as recommended. After giving next vaccine about 15 minutes later patient apparently tried to come across waiting room to speak to me and started to fall. Next patient was leaving room and caught patient, preventing injury and called for help. Multiple staff responded. Patient reported dizziness and seeing colors. Was breathing fast but not having any swelling or trouble breathing. Was able to stand after a minute and was taken to clinic that is right next to pharmacy for evaluation. Patient was evaluated and left within the next hour doing well. Spoke to patient in the afternoon and reports recovering well, has a headache that he thinks is stress related. Counseled to continue to monitor and seek medical attention if any worsening of symptoms.

18 2021-03-30 thirst Fever, Headace, shivering, thirsty
18 2021-04-05 mouth numbness My healthy 18-year old son had his first dose of Pfizer, and within a few minutes he felt dizzy. His... Read more
Close
My healthy 18-year old son had his first dose of Pfizer, and within a few minutes he felt dizzy. His heart rate was also rapid. He didn't think much of it, but the dizziness persisted and so they had him lay down with feet up. After about 20 minutes, he began to vigorously shake (rigors I believe is what it is called.) He felt numb in both arms and also his tongue and mouth. We had 3 nurses attending to him, and after about 30 minutes they decided to send him to the ER for evaluation since the very strong shaking and other symptoms were worsening. The shaking, dizziness, numbness all subsided after about an hour. He was given a Zyrtec upon first symptoms about 15 minutes after dose. The ER doc doesn't believe it was an allergic reaction but potentially a strong vasovagal response and immune response. He felt tired after but was completely fine 2 hours later. We were discharged from the ER a few hours later after evaluation. Vitals were in normal range including blood sugar, blood pressure and oxygen. He was fully hydrated prior and had a turkey sandwich and orange prior to coming so was not low on food either. The shaking was very extreme and concerning. It has been almost 24 hours and he is feeling fine other than a sore arm.

18 2021-04-14 sensitivity to light Patient received the Pfizer COVID vaccine (Lot EW0150, exp 7/2021) dose 1 at 1400. At 1405, EMT appr... Read more
Close
Patient received the Pfizer COVID vaccine (Lot EW0150, exp 7/2021) dose 1 at 1400. At 1405, EMT approached patient who appeared pale and diaphoretic with his eyes closed. PHN approached to assess, patient had slow speech and pulse felt thready. Vital signs: O2 99%, pulse 56, respirations 24. Patient had thick sweatshirt on EMT had difficulty obtaining blood pressure. Paramedic approached to assist. At 1410, PHN, EMT, and paramedic transfered patient to zero gravity chair and placed in reclining position. Patient was offered water and he verbalized feeling better. Patient denied allergies, medical conditions, or medications. PHN assisted patient in removing sweatshirt partially to obtain blood pressure. Vital signs: O2 99%, pulse 51, blood pressure 92/60, respirations 24. PHN offered Benadryl but patient declined. PHN advised on when to call 911. At 1422, patient reported light sensitivity and blurry vision. At 1425, vital signs: pulse 52, respirations 18, O2 99%, blood pressure 118/84. At 1535, vital signs: O2 99%, pulse 58, respirations 18, blood pressure 110/66. Patient reported continued improvement in symptoms, only feeling tired. Patient reported working out, only sleeping 2 hours that night, and not eating before coming in. PHN called family member at patient's request to drive patient home. At 1439, patient assisted to seated position in zero-gravity chair by PHN and EMT. Patient reported symptoms had resolved and he felt back to baseline. At 1445, patient stood up, monitored closely by PHN and EMT. At 1449, patient left walking with steady gait to parking lot where family member was waiting to drive patient home.

Systemic: Confusion-Medium, Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Medium, Systemic: Fainting / Unresponsive-Severe, Systemic: Nausea-Medium, Additional Details: Pt mother stated pt was nauseous and then that he was passing out. RN ran over to check on pt as pt eye rolled back and pt limbs fell limp. Pt moved to the floor by RN, rolled to the side by RN. Pt regained consciousness almost immediately and was laid on his back with feet elevated. Pt stated he felt fine, did not recall exactly what happened. Pt helped up into chair, given water and crackers. Pt stated he felt fine, observed by medical personnel for 30 min and pt was able to ambulate off site.

Vision problem. My son has been a homeschooled student for many years, using computer for his schooling without any problems. He had a minor injury to one eye shortly before the vaccination (scratched with hand), but after the shot, he complained of vision problems in both eyes. Redness, dryness, pressure, uncomfortable. Unable to concentrate and stay reading for more than a few minutes at a time. His primary doctor is now treating with antibiotic drops, but will take him to the eye doctor if he does not get better by Thursday as he will be done with the eye drops. We have also added allergy medicine, which seems to help a little. He is due for his second shot on 4/29. I still need him to get the shot to be protected from Covid, so hopefully, he will be better.

After the first dose, I experienced tinnitus about every day for a week or two afterwards. The tinnitus would be present in one or both ears and last about 5-10 minutes. Illness set in roughly 30 min after the second dose. Illness has lasted throughout the last 4 days, and even through today. This would indicate the vaccine has made me ill for about 5 days now. Caused me to go to the doctor as I assumed the reaction couldn't be from the vaccine so long after the dose.

18 2021-04-23 thirst Overnight, my (almost 19) son did not wake me, but reported to me in the morning that he had headach... Read more
Close
Overnight, my (almost 19) son did not wake me, but reported to me in the morning that he had headaches, chills, numbness, thirst, and hallucinations. He was aware that they were not real during and after he had them, but it was a nonetheless disturbing experience. He described to me having the need to hydrate all night and he drank a lot of water. This morning he was still having a headache and numbness as well as overall malaise, but has taken advil and eaten a light breakfast. He is dressed and up and around and seems to be improving. Should the symptoms return or worsen, we plan to take him for medical care.
18 2021-04-25 hearing loss, visual impairment Patient received his first dose of Pfizer vaccine and waited 15 minutes in the observation area. Upo... Read more
Close
Patient received his first dose of Pfizer vaccine and waited 15 minutes in the observation area. Upon rising from chair, patient reported feeling dizzy and faint. Patient called for assistance. Patient reported feeling hot and sweaty and being unable to hear and see correctly. Pulse and SpO2 were taken, Pulse was initially 54 bpm and rose to 68 bpm after drinking water. SpO2 was 94-95% RA. Patient refused EMS. Patient reported feeling better after about 20 minutes. Hearing and vision improved. Patient remained in observation area for another 20 minutes before leaving in stable condition.
18 2021-04-26 ringing in ears Patient had flushing/sweating, ringing in ears, nausea. Stable, released from vaccination site.
18 2021-04-26 vision blurred, eye movement disorder Recipient received dose #2 vaccine today, and almost immediately had response with witnessed seizure... Read more
Close
Recipient received dose #2 vaccine today, and almost immediately had response with witnessed seizure-like activity, with posturing, tonic-clonic movement of his upper extremities, and eye movement with lateral nystagmus. Loss of consciousness was noted. Symptoms lasted approximately 15-30 seconds, and patient was placed in a reclined position. He regained consciousness quickly and became pale and diaphoretic. He was normally responsive and answered questions appropriately. Initial BP 74/32, HR 38, SpO2 98%. He drank some Gatorade and had improvement of symptoms gradually over 15-20 minutes. Repeat BP 100/58, HR 78. No past history of seizures. One prior syncopal event after pain response with sports injury. No prior difficulty with dose #1. After recovery, patient reported immediate pain with vaccine administration, then vision went blurry and he lost consciousness. Mother was driving the vehicle, and she witness symptoms as well as nursing staff in the vaccine pod. After recovery, options for further medical evaluation were discussed given complicated vasovagal response with seizure-like activity, mother called pediatrician to see if he could be seen, they recommended ER. Mother chose to drive by personal vehicle, rather than EMS transport. Symptoms were fully resolved and patient was transported to ER for further evaluation by personal vehicle.

Close
Soreness in arm that rapidly came on roughly 10 hours later, but subsided significantly following 24 hours after the shot was given. All soreness subsided within 3 days. Sudden sensitivity to light developed about 26 hours after the shot was given. This side effect remained for about 8 days afterwards and still has some very slight residual effect (now 12 days after).

Close
Patient received Pfizer vaccine on left deltoid and immediately displayed seizure like activity while sitting down. Patient eyes rolled back and was briefly unresponsive for a few seconds. EMS was notifed at this time. The patient was assisted and carried down to the matted floor and feet were elevated on a chair. Patient did become responsive and was alert and oriented but continued be dizzy. Patient did not have labored breathing or respiratory distress at this time. Patient's vital signs were taken at 14:50: 130/71, 80hr, 95% PsO2, 18rr The fire department arrived and transported patient to Hospital. Patient did have another seizure like activity and patient's heart rate dropped into the 40-50s. Peripheral IV on right hand was initiated and bolused. Patient's mother, was notified of event and patient's sister who was waiting outside was brought into facility. Patient's sister who is 14 years old was later picked up by mother.

Close
unable to hear anything; Feeling funny; pale; diaphoretic; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable healthcare professional. An 18-year-old male patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), dose 1 intramuscular, administered in Arm Left on 15Apr2021 (Lot Number: EW0164) as single dose for covid-19 immunisation, administered at the hospital. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. On 15Apr2021, the patient started "feeling funny", "was unable to hear anything", opened his eyes with a bunch of people standing in front of him; pale, diaphoretic, brought to the emergency department for evaluation. The patient did not receive treatment for the events. Outcome of the events was recovered in Apr2021.; Sender's Comments: Based on the limited information provided and plausible temporal association, the Company (Pfizer) cannot exclude that the suspect medication may have contributed to the reported serious event in this patient. Additional information regarding relevant medical history, underlying conditions and concomitant medications will aid in the comprehensive assessment of the case. The impact of this report on the benefit-risk profile of the Pfizer product and on the conduct of the study is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, ethics committees. and investigators, as appropriate.

18 2021-06-01 ringing in ears Severe fatigue; Right hand started twitching uncontrollably; Had pain but it did not go across chest... Read more
Close
Severe fatigue; Right hand started twitching uncontrollably; Had pain but it did not go across chest like after first dose vaccine; Had numbness down arms and legs; Had vertigo really bad; Was very hot, no fever, but radiating heat; Muscle pain; Mind numbing migraine pain in the caller's son's head; Body was hot allover, and his skin turned red; had periodic pins and needles with the numbness; Dizziness; Difficulty sleeping; Chest tightness periodically, but not consistently; Chest pain; Ear ringing; General malaise; Can't walk to the end of the block without coming back in pain; Found it hard to concentrate; Cloudy head; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient's mother). An 18-years-old male patient received of bnt162b2 (BNT162B2, Formulation: Solution for injection) via an unspecified route of administration in left arm on 07May2021 12:10 (Lot Number: EW0183; Expiration Date: 31Aug2021) as 2nd dose, single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included lyme disease ongoing from 2013 and it was reported that her son had no tick bite & was diagnosed through a blood test. Her son had fatigue, migraines, lethargy & the doxycycline made him sick as a dog. A chiropractor had success using various tinctures & after 1 to 1-1/2 years, her son went into remission. Her son has a low degree of pain & soreness & has learned to deal with the pain. When his immune system is triggered, his Lyme disease comes back & he takes tinctures for a week or 2 & his symptoms goes away. No further details provided. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The patient previously received first dose of BNT162B2 (Lot number: EW0164 and Expiry date: 31Aug2021) administered in left arm for COVID-19 immunisation and experienced chest pain, headaches and light-headed. Patient also had his first HPV Vaccine, laid out flat for a week and had no problems with the meningitis. On 07May2021, after second dose of vaccine administration, the patient had pain but it did not go across chest like after first dose vaccine, numbness down arms and legs, really bad vertigo, was very hot, no fever, but radiating heat, muscle pain, dizziness, mind numbing migraine pain in head, body was hot allover, skin turned red and right hand started twitching uncontrollably. On an unspecified date in May2021, the patient had periodic pins and needles with the numbness, difficulty sleeping, chest tightness periodically, but not consistently, chest pain, severe fatigue, ear ringing, general malaise, can't walk to the end of the block without coming back in pain, found it hard to concentrate and cloudy head. It was reported that the caller's son had the pain but it did not go across his chest like after the first dose Pfizer Covid 19 vaccination. The caller's son had numbness down his arms and legs and her son's legs were real heavy. The caller's son had to help life his legs to get his legs to move. The caller's son had vertigo really bad. The vertigo was so bad the caller's son had to lay down on the stretcher as the vaccination site. Even sitting up, the caller's son's world was spinning. The caller's son had to lay down. It was very hot, no fever, but radiating heat: The caller's son was very hot, no fever, but radiating heat. Part of that was the vaccination centre was not air conditioned and the caller's son was already a little uncomfortably warm when he went in. Dry ice packs were placed on the caller's son's head, went through three dry ice packs melting on the caller's son. The dry ice packs were on the caller's son's forehead and back of his neck and the injection site. The caller was trying to give her son coolness the best she could. He stayed about 30 minutes at the vaccination site and nothing improved or got worse. He was still very heavily dizzy or whatever and got in the wheelchair and got home. The caller's son did nothing for the rest of the day or weekend. The caller's son was just in so much pain and so much dizziness, it was just too much to do anything. The caller's son's symptoms gradually improved but very minute. The amount of dizziness the caller's son had was a little less so he could sit up at the computer, but even that the caller's son had to take breaks and couldn't do it for more than 30 minutes before laying back down. Had pain but it did not go across chest like after first dose vaccine: The caller's son's pain was a little less intense. The caller's son's numbness by Monday, 10May2021, had subsided for the most part. The caller's son is still having numbness down his arm, the opposite arm the caller's son received the second dose Pfizer COVID-19 Vaccine. The caller's son is also having numbness in his thighs sometimes, but not constantly. Clarifies the thighs or upper legs. The caller took her son to a Chiropractor and the Chiropractor gave her son a couple supplements to detoxify. That seemed to actually make things worse. The caller also took her son to the doctor's office. The caller took her son to a Chiropractor and the Chiropractor gave her son a couple supplements to detoxify: The caller states these were Charcoal and Magnesium combination and Turmeric root extract. Reporter made her son hydrate and use the generic Acetaminophen 500mg Caplets, along with a pain tea. The pain tea was loose herbs of valerian root, peppermint, and skull cap and pain tea seemed to help her son more for his pain, and mask some of the general malaise, and allowed her son to study for his AP Calculus exam. Patient's pain went from an 11-12 and was now at a 6 or 7. patient had a high tolerance for pain, and could cope with the pain, but the pain made it difficult for him to concentrate. Patient's migraine pain was unbearable at times and made it difficult for him. The generic Acetaminophen 500mg caplet with the pain tea helped to manage so his migraine pain was not so extreme. Therapeutic measures included Liposomal Resveratrol 38mg Curcumin from turmeric root extract 100mg, dietary supplement (Lot: 00728B or 007288). She has reported that she had been giving her tylenol for muscular pain and migraine. Other treatment included: alternating between Advil (Liqui-Gels) and Tylenol (generic acetaminophen 500mg caplets), Advil Liqui-Gels 200mg Ibuprofen (UPC Number: 0573176914, Lot Number: R77157, Expiration Date: Mar2022), Generic Acetaminophen 500mg Caplets, NDC Number: 21130-111-90, Lot Number: 1AV1505 and Expiration Date: Nov2022). Reported in the evenings her son would take Advil PM (200mg Ibuprofen with Diphenhydramine Citrate 38mg), NDC/UPC Number: Unknown, Lot Number: EG1024 and Expiration Date: Jun2023. Reporter said that Advil didn't seem to work on her son's migraine headache like the Advil usually does. Outcome of the events pain but it did not go across chest like after first dose vaccine, numbness down arms and legs and vertigo really bad, muscle pain, mind numbing migraine pain in the caller's son's head, periodic pins and needles with the numbness, right hand started twitching uncontrollably, chest tightness periodically, but not consistently, chest pain and ear ringing as recovering, outcome of the event body was hot all over, and his skin turned red was recovered, outcome of the event difficulty sleeping as not recovered and outcome of the events dizziness, severe fatigue, general malaise, can't walk to the end of the block without coming back in pain, found it hard to concentrate and cloudy head as unknown. Information on Lot/Batch number was available. Additional information has been requested.

Close
Approximately 5 minutes after receiving the vaccine, the patient passed out and his eyes rolled back (possible seizure activity). This activity lasted for approximately 1 minute. Patient also felt dizzy, sweaty, nauseous, and became pale. Patient was given a cold ice pack to lower his body temperature. Patient was also given crackers for nausea, and a bag just incase he had to vomit. Patient's mother was also here to tend to the patient. The mother also gave him clear fluids (sprite) to help with the nausea. After approximately 10 minutes, the patient was able to stand without feeling dizzy. He left the store with his mother to be watched closely (His mother is a nurse.) They also refused emergency medical services.
18 2021-06-09 blindness Patient became dizzy and heart began racing a few minutes after immunization. Increased dizziness an... Read more
Close
Patient became dizzy and heart began racing a few minutes after immunization. Increased dizziness and then patient began having rigors that continued for 1 hour and 20 minutes post vaccination. He also experienced numbness in his body as well as warmth in his stomach and extremities. He was given Benadryl soon after vaccination. He was sent to the ER of to be monitored. Vitals and labs were deemed to be OK. Rigors ceased 20 minutes after arriving at the ER. He was monitored for a couple of hours and subsequently discharged. He has had severe fatigue. The day following immunization, he had another episode of rigors and numbness. Paramedics were called and evaluated patient at home. Patient then began having panic attacks and losing vision, brain fog, dizziness, and body numbness that have continued since that time. He has also had recurrent episodes of paranoia that started 3-4 days post vaccination and continue today. Patient has seen immunologist and is seeing psychologist weekly for counseling and EDMR. He has seen ophthalmologist as well as his primary care physician.

Nurse stated her son had the normal flu like symptoms afterwards when he was sore and didn't feel well in May2021. A day later(in May2021) his bottom lips swelled just his bottom lips there was no oropharyngeal response on the side of the lips. He took Benadryl and about 8 to 12 hours later it went down. On Thursday(27May2021), his right hand swelled up around the size, she meant twice the size of his normal hand would be, that also lasted around 12 hours or so. Today(in May2021) he called her from work and his scrotum was swollen. And she was trying to find out if this was a normal, she was a nurse working in an emergency department and this was not a normal response in anyone else that she had heard of who had gotten the vaccine but she wanted to call to see if this was something maybe somebody else has experienced, or one of the doctor, one of the doctor that she work with prescribed a Medrol dose pack for him just in case. The outcome of the event 'bottom lips swelled was recovering, of the event right hand swelled up around the size(twice the size of his normal hand would be) was recovered in May2021, of the other events was unknown.

Vaccine location was arm left. Relevant medical history included asthma. No relevant concomitant medications were provided. The patient was vaccinated at hospital, age at vaccination was 19-year-old. No known allergies. No other vaccine was received in four weeks. Post-vaccination COVID test was not performed. The patient had salt water taste in mouth, lasted strongly 5 minutes immediately after injection. Got less strong as time went on for approx 45 minutes after injection. This was followed with dry mouth with lasted an addition 30 minutes. The onset date of the events 05Jan2021 at 13:45 (as reported). The patient was not treated for the events. The patient recovered from the events on 05Jan2021.

Close
20 minutes after receiving the shot, my throat became tight and uncomfortable, and I felt like something was stuck in my throat. I was constantly trying to swallow to make the sensation go away. The throat tightness lasted but became progressively better for about 4 hours, until about an hour after I took 50mg Benadryl, when it went away completely.

Close
Pt reports generalized body aches, fatigue, fever 3/26, one day after receiving vaccine. Evaluated at ED 3/28, received Ketorolac and was discharged. While in parking lot, patient experienced blurring of vision, lightheadedness, nausea, SOB, and left-sided chest pain with return for re-evaluation. Pt treated for possible allergic reaction and concurrent EKG and blood work showed elevated troponin and transient ST elevation. Cardiology consulted and evaluated patient to have severe acute onset systolic heart failure, cardiogenic shock with pulmonary edema, Idiopathic fulminant myocarditis with myonecrosis, and hypoxic respiratory failure. Placed on furosemide, supplemental oxygen, and pending MRI.

He said he saw white beautiful light. I am not kidding. He does not joke. Then he said he was fine. Insisted he was fine. His bp was low for the first two readings. Then It came back up to normal. Approximately 10 minutes after receiving Pfizer COVID vaccine pt c/o "foggy vision" and nausea. Taken to stretcher, BP: 126/74, HR: 61, RR: 16 nonlabored, SaO2: 98% on RA. H/o tree nut allergy - mouth swelling. To ED via w/c. 1310: report to nurse. 1315: c/o HA at this time, no change in vision sx, with nurse. ED Note: A 19 y.o. male with a history of multiple prior RUE surgeries and tree nut allergy who presents with blurred vision. In the ED, he is very well appearing and in NAD. VS WNL. On physical exam, he is neurovascularly intact. On ophthalmalgic exam, his pupils at 5 mm bilaterally briskly reactive (does have some light sensitivity), painless full EOM, normal visual fields. On my testing of visual acuity, mildly decreased in the left; however on Doctor it is was mildly decreased in the right. Overall no significant deficit in visual acuity. Patient denies ocular trauma. No ocular pain. Sclera/conjunctiva is not injected. I feel presentation is most likely an adverse reaction to the vaccination. Not consistent with allergic reaction. Overall his examination is reassuring against an acute ocular emergency. Patient does also state that his symptoms are improving. Received Benadryl in triage. Will report and call Pfizer, poison control, and ophtho.

Close
Patient is a 19yo male who experienced a near syncopal episode immediately after receiving his first dose of Pfzier covid 19 vaccine. Patient c/o dizziness and tinnitus, patient then noted altered level of conciousness, w/o complete loss of consciousness. Upon assessment patient noted with significant diaphoresis, noted generalized clammy skin, no skin lesions, rash or hives noted. respiratory rate WNL, respirations even and unlabored. Within less that 60 seconds patient started to regain alertness and was able to respond and answer questions appropriately. Reported feeling some anxiety prior to getting vaccine but denied being diagnosed or treated with anxiety. reported prior episode with similar less severe symptoms associated with "shots" within >2 minutes patient was A&O x4, verbal and able to make needs known. Respiration remained even and unlabored. Skin pink warm and intact with significantly decreased clamminess and diaphoresis. No sx/sx of allergic reaction. Chest is non-tender, initially bradycardia @ 43 BPM, noted irregular heart rhythm, no murmur or extra sounds noted. Pt reports playing football with practicing at least 4 days weekly. Denies significant past medical HX. No HX of allergies. Patient was assisted to yoga mat on ground, in supine position with lower extremities elevated. Physical assessment completed then past medical HX obtained from PT. Initial VS 100/50. HR 43, o2 96% ECG obtained by EMTS WNL. Spontaneous resolution of symptoms after 1-2 minutes. Patient was assisted to sitting position, then standing w/o return of symptoms. VS @ 5 mins 114/63 HR 63 RR 18 o2 98%. Patient escorted to observation area and sitting in chair. Patient was observed for 30 mins in observation area. After 30 minutes no acute distresss noted, pt denied pain, dizziness, tinnitus or other symptoms. Advised patient to abstain from strenuous activity for the rest of the day and advised against football practice today and against being alone today. Advised patient to seek emergency treatment by calling 911 should symptoms return, experience SOB, or any sx/sx of an allergic reaction. Patient verbalized understanding before leaving vaccine site @ 1610

severe dehydration; severe dehydration; thirst; could not sleep at night/ lack of sleep/ sleep interrupted; she had never heard him so anxious or disturbed that he could not get relief; she had never heard him so anxious or disturbed that he could not get relief; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable consumer (medical technologist). A 19-year-old male patient (reporter's grandson) received BNT61B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number not reported), on 04Mar2021 (at the age of 19-year-old) as 1st dose, single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Vaccine was not administered at military facility. The patient's medical history included diabetic (since 1 years old, he was diagnosed 1 week after getting the measles/mumps/rubella (MMR) vaccine), dehydrated and rapid heartbeat (patient once before got dehydrated on the Hiking Trail with a rapid heartbeat). The patient's concomitant medications included insulin for diabetic. The patient previously received measles/mumps/rubella (MMR) vaccine. The reporter (caller) mentioned that his grandson got the 1st dose of the vaccine on 04Mar2021. Several hours later (04Mar2021), he experienced severe dehydration and thirst and could not sleep at night. He was very very uncomfortable and usually did not complain regarding experiences. He was young and going to college and he was living on his own. He was also diabetic. She was worried about his safety regarding his intake of the 2nd dose, so she was wondering if this had been reported and for any recommendations before and after getting the 2nd dose. They were consulting with his endocrinologist and the nurse at the endocrinologist's clinic said that they recommend young diabetic people to drink tons of water when getting the vaccine. Caller mentioned that she herself got the Pfizer vaccine and had no problem with it. Caller mentioned that his Grandson was diabetic since 1 years old. He was diagnosed 1 week after getting the MMR vaccine. She also mentioned that his grandson just recently got in college and he was in the younger side of the spectrum. Caller is asking if there is any data that would include her grandson's conditions in the clinical trials. Caller stated she was calling about the Pfizer COVID Vaccine and stated her grandson who was the patient was the one who received his first dose of the vaccine on 04Mar2021 and that day he received the vaccine he told her that starting in the evening that same day (04Mar2021) she had never heard him so anxious or disturbed that he could not get relief and the adverse reaction he had was severe dehydration and thirst and it was giving him a fit. Caller stated she thinks he was probably 5'10'' in height or so and thinks he weighed around and between 175-180 pounds when she last asked him. Caller stated she was not an HCP but was a medical technologist calling on behalf of the patient and because she was a medical technologist, she is medically trained. Caller stated she had not been able to get back in touch with the patient to get all the details for the report before she called around to get help but also stated the patient had his sleep interrupted after the vaccine was administered and he could not sleep but thinks this is all resolved and must have been resolved but she couldn't say for certain how long that he could not sleep or how long the severe dehydration or thirst lasted but she can find out. Caller stated the patient had not yet had the 2nd dose of the Pfizer COVID Vaccine and had his patient card and stated she did not have the lot, expiry date or NDC for the first dose. Caller stated for the indication for which the patient was administered the COVID vaccine, she thought because the patient was diabetic and the HCP was very anxious for him to have defense against COVID and against all various types of virus or the school may have required it but she was not sure; states it was for the patient's own safety that his endocrinologist wanted him to have the vaccine. Caller stated that the patient did not have treatment for the reported event and he did not say to her that he had any treatment; caller stated she doubted the infirmary at his school is even open at the University and she did not know whether the patient would go to the infirmary or not. Caller stated she was calling to find out of there have been any reports or feedback on this reaction that the patient had or the adverse situation the patient had several hours after receiving the Pfizer COVID Vaccine; states specifically for the severe dehydration and thirst the patient experienced after being administered the Pfizer COVID Vaccine. Caller stated the patient was due to get his 2nd dose of the Pfizer COVID vaccine three weeks from 04Mar2021 and she was most anxious to find out what recommendations were given or if Pfizer heard complaints about other adverse events like the ones she was reporting on the patient. Caller stated the patient once before got dehydrated on the Hiking Trail with a rapid heartbeat and he was with his father at that time; no further details provided by the caller. Caller stated the patient reported this to her in conversation a day or so after he had the Pfizer COVID Vaccine and she is medically trained and it has been a long time since she used that medical training but the patient is diabetic since the age of 1 and he had good care and has been under the care of the hospital endocrinologist and his HCP since he was found to have diabetes and he uses his insulin pump very well. Caller stated the patient was off to college where very few were attending college and the patient had a very undesirable evening after the vaccine of lack of sleep and he was so thirsty and could not get hydrated and she knows dehydration is bad for anybody even if they aren't diabetic or if they have a life threatening type of illness but the patient was at school and did not have a family member to help take care of him and he was due for his 2nd shot three weeks from 04Mar2021. Caller stated she was trying to find out the best route for him to go report this and she told him to report the reaction to the HCP and to call the HCP who prescribed the vaccine; stated the patient's endocrinologist was not able to get in touch with the patient and he was not answering the phone; stated the patient is at college and he was on online courses. Caller stated she was very anxious to find out enough information about this and it is a concern to his treating physician and she was asking about recommendations about the patient not having his 2nd dose of the Pfizer COVID Vaccine; stated she spoke with the nurse that works with the endocrinologist for all of these 18 years they have cared for the patient. Caller states the HCP's nurse stated she had found that patients that receive the vaccine and have diabetes and are treated at the hospital they recommend that those patients drink tons and tons of water before having the vaccine because some types of people with diabetes have extreme thirst. Caller stated she had no vaccine names, patient information or lot number or other information to provide on the patients that had the vaccine and have diabetes. Caller stated she spoke at the HCP office and stated there was no need for secrecy and HIPPA was not in Pfizer's domain; stated she cannot depend on the patient to look out for his own safety and she as a medical technologist used to give patients ordered glucose tolerance tests and she knew of the reactions that occurred with those patients and she did not want the patient to be stuck and wanted for him to do the smart thing of spending the night at home rather than drive back. Caller stated for those patients she administered glucose tests to she had no patient information or lot numbers or other information to provide and it was years ago before the Pfizer COVID vaccine came out. Caller stated she worked trying to get patient's diabetes under control at the University where she worked. Caller stated she already called and waited for organization but did not speak to anyone and left them a number to call her back a couple of days ago but she had not heard back; stated there were 18 people in the phone queue before her and she was hoping not to have to wait again. Caller stated her grandson probably does not had the time to wait on the phone being at college and he needed to do what he needed to do to be safe. Caller stated she had only spoken with the endocrinologist who treats the patient in his hometown and reported this information to the HCP's nurse and they are pretty good with follow up with patients. Caller stated she did not think the patient had other health issues and he actually had done extremely well on his insulin pump and had been on the insulin pump since about 3 years of age; stated she had no name of the insulin, had no lot numbers or further information. The events did not require emergency room or physician office visit. The outcome of the events was unknown. No follow-up attempts are needed; information about lot/batch number cannot be obtained.

19 yo M with PMH of asthma and obesity who presents with one week of vision loss in left eye and new onset intermittent headache. Hre ported that he received his first dose of the Pfizer COVID vaccine on 5/3. Then he got the second dose on 5/13. On 5/14 he noticed headaches. On 5/16 he had vision loss in his right eye. This got worse so he came in on 5/19. He had an area of black vision in the upper quadrants of his visual fields and then blurriness in the rest of his vision in that eye. The other eye was unaffected. He had an exam by opthalmology which showed papilledema. He was seen by neurology and had an MRI of the Brain and orbits which showed L optic neuritis as well as a punctate area in the L frontal lobe of unclear significance. CSF with WBC count of 2, normal protein of 23. He had positive oligoclonal bands. Negaitve NMO and MOG. His vision started to improve with high dose steroids. he was discharged home.

Close
had to treat him with an ammonia thing to wake him up; could not see/lost vision at one time immediately afterwards; vision got all spotty; pupils got bigger than normal; Blue lips; white face; blood pressure really dropped; felt cold; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (father) reported for a son. A 19-year-old male patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in left upper arm in muscle on 07May2021 17:00 (Batch/Lot number was not reported) at age of 19-year-old as single dose for covid-19 immunisation. There was no medical history. No family medical history relevant to events. There were no concomitant medications. No additional vaccines administered on same date of the Pfizer Suspect. No prior vaccinations (within 4 weeks). On 07May2021, his vision got all spotty and he could not see, pupils got bigger than normal after the vaccine, had blue lips, white face, blood pressure really dropped, and he lost vision at one time immediately afterwards, and he felt cold. The time of onset of events was around 5pm. Events did not require a visit to emergency room or physician office. They stated they had given a thousand of this vaccine and this had never happened before. They stated they had never seen what happened to his son before. The patient did not get the second one yet and was told not to get it. All events happened a few minutes after the vaccine during the sitting/waiting period. About after 5 minutes the most after administration this all started and they had to treat him with an ammonia thing to wake him up. It's the one you break it under the nose and they were ready to do an Epi Pen also if needed. He improved within half an hour to 45 minutes of this. No other vaccines given that day or 4 weeks prior. No problems with vaccines in past. Mentioned they all in his family did the Covid vaccine. The patient improved and they advised him not to get the second one. It was Facility to tell them that. The pharmacist from there just gave them a call wanting to know why the son didn't return for the second dose and he explained what happened since this pharmacist did not know what happened that day. Patient did not see doctor or go to emergency room since his condition improved dramatically after about 45 minutes or so. Father kept asking patient how he felt or if there was need to see doctor and patient declined. The outcome of events was recovering. Information about lot/batch number has been requested.

On 24Mar2021, the patient was diagnosed with Covid, it was stated that actually got Covid in between the first and the second dose. The patient underwent laboratory tests and procedures on 23Mar2021 which included SARS-COV-2 TEST: result was found positive on 24Mar2021. He received no treatment for events. No additional vaccines were administered on Same date of the Pfizer Suspect. The patient did not visit to emergency room. He did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. It was stated the only symptom left that he had was that the taste and smell were present but the other symptoms were gone and he knew it would take a while for taste and smell to come back. Description of complaint: He has not yet had the second dose of the Pfizer Vaccine but it was scheduled for 10Apr2021. It was stated that he was out of quarantine on the day of this report and had no fever and had nothing and was all healed. He had no treatment for the reported event. The events of sore throat, fever, was resolved on an unknown date in 2021. The outcome of event actually got COVID in between the first and the second dose was unknown; however, the outcome of the events of lost his taste and smell was reported as not resolved. His patient card had no expiry date or NDC to provide. No follow up attempts were possible. No further information was expected.

Close
Dizziness upon standing and walking, nausea, clamy and warm skin, sweaty, pale, tunnel vision, loss of acute memory, vision, and hearing. Patient was watched from 3pm (right after dose) to 3:30pm. He was feeling these symptoms from 3pm to about 3:15pm. He was given water after 5 minutes and cold wash rags to put on his forehead and neck. He was also told to breath deep breaths slowly. He said his throat felt sore and was provided with a throat lozenge. Color in his face returned after roughly 10 to 15 minutes and he verbally said he was feeling much better. Pharmacy associates watched him for another 15 minutes to make sure he was okay.

No symptoms from first dose. Immediately after second dose, injected arm felt numb/tingly. When seated at observation area, began to feel nauseous, dizzy, and began sweating. Rose to ask site staff for help, felt very uneven. Taken to back observation room and laid down on a cot. Blood pressure observed at 85/30, significantly lower than normal. Rested for approximately 15 minutes, then sat up. Nausea and blurry vision returned. No change in blood pressure. Blood was drawn, sugar and other indicators normal. Sat up again, feelings returned. Drank two water bottles and began to feel better, blood pressure returned to low end of normal after around 15 minutes. General weakness persisted throughout day, along with mild pain at injection site and in neck.

20 2021-04-30 permanent deafness, conjunctivitis, ringing in ears Initial presentation Patient was in his usual state of good health until 4/19 when he received his f... Read more
Close
Initial presentation Patient was in his usual state of good health until 4/19 when he received his first dose of the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine. Two hours after the injection he became nauseous and vomited multiple times. Overnight he experienced diffuse myalgia and suprapubic pain. He awoke the next day to a pustular rash on his chin, forehead, chest and back. The patient describes similar previous rashes that have resolved spontaneously. The next day he began to experience gross hematuria and presented to the ED with a temperature of 98.9, blood pressure of 100/69mmHg, heart rate of 110bpm, respiratory rate of 18 breaths per minute and an O2 saturation of 97% on room air. On examination, patient was ill-appearing with diffuse pustules on his face, chest and back, periorbital edema, and leukoplakia of the tongue and buccal mucosa. His abdomen was soft and tender to palpation in the suprapubic area and at both costovertebral angles. Hospital course In the ED the patient was found to have a metabolic acidosis of pH 7.33 with an anion gap of 16, lactate 2.6, neutrophilic leukocytosis (22k), acute renal insufficiency with a BUN of 45 and creatinine 3.81 (baseline is 0.76). The patient?s urine demonstrated packed RBCs and 5-10 WBCs. He was admitted to the medicine service for further management. On the medicine floor he was initially found to have rhabdomyolysis (CK 584), worsening renal failure (Creatinine 8), follicular conjunctivitis by skin biopsy, a low CD3/CD4 count (CD4 91, CD3 47, CD8 258) with normal complement, and bilateral tinnitus. CT A/P without contrast showed increased attenuation of renal pelves and ureters consistent with hemorrhage, but no renal stones or hydronephrosis was seen. The patient was treated with pulse dose 500mg IV Methylprednisilone for 3 days and then transitioned to 60mg Prednisone. The patient?s pustular rash and oral leukoplakia greatly improved while on pulse dose steroids, but his kidney function continued to decline (Creatinine rising from 8 to 11), and the patient?s bilateral tinnitus progressed to bilateral sensorineural deafness over 2 days. Bilateral hearing loss prompted an MRI of the brain which identified several punctate infarcts across multiple vascular territories in bilateral cortices and left cerebellum. The patient?s kidney function has continued to decline, with progressive hyperkalemia and hemodialysis was begun.

Close
Today, I had this weird metallic taste in my mouth. I saw some other people online had noticed this after their shot too, so I wanted to let y'all know. When I got the shot at first, my arm really hurt at the site of the shot and as I walked back home afterwards, my whole left side felt weird. That evening, I was extraordinarily tired. Now I feel better, but that was a doozy

Pt left with steady gait, no distress reported. 1:49 Pt returned to clinic, c/o throat and tongue feeling warm, pt appeared anxious and pale. PT placed in seated position RN at pt side. 1:50 J. Staff at pts side. Vitals BP 170/110, HR 121, RR 26, 98% o2. EMS called by RN. Epi pen ready at pts side, no Epi administered at this time. 1:52 Pt continues to present pale, small cough noted, pt denies swelling to throat, reports warm sensation to tongue and throat, ?My tongue and throat feel different.? Noted redness to outer sclera bilaterally. Speech clear. worsening renal failure/kidney function continued to decline; gross hematuria; follicular conjunctivitis; a low CD3/CD4 count (CD4 91, CD347, CD8 258); a low CD3/CD4 count (CD4 91, CD347, CD8 258); The patient's unilateral tinnitus progressed to bilateral sensorineural deafness over 2 days; The patient's unilateral tinnitus progressed to bilateral sensorineural deafness over 2 days; pustular rash on his chin forehead, chest and back; nauseous; diffuse myalgia; vomited; suprapubic pain; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable other healthcare professional. A 20-year-old male patient first dose of received bnt162b2 (BNT162B2), intramuscular, administered in left arm on 19Apr2021, at the age of 20-years old, (Lot Number: EW0151) as SINGLE DOSE for covid-19 immunisation. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. Prior to vaccination, the patient has not been diagnosed with COVID-19. It was reported that the patient was in his usual state of good health until 19Apr2021, when he received his first dose of the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine. Two hours after the injection he became nauseous and vomited multiple times. Overnight he experienced diffuse myalgia and suprapubic pain. On 20Apr2021, he woke up the next day to a pustular rash on his chin, forehead, chest and back. The patient describes similar previous rashes that have resolved spontaneously. On21Apr2021, he began to experience gross hematuria and presented to the Emergency department. On the medicine floor he was initially found to have worsening renal failure, follicular conjunctivitis by skin biopsy, a low CD3/CD4 count (CD4 91, CD3 47, CD8 258) with normal complement, and bilateral tinnitus. The patient's unilateral tinnitus progressed to bilateral sensorineural deafness over 2 days. His kidney function continued to decline and hemodialysis was begun on 27Apr2021. His kidney function continued to decline on hemodialysis, becoming so he was transferred to the MICU for CRRT. The patient was hospitalized for 12 days due to the events, the events were also assessed as life-threathening. The patient been tested for COVID-19 post vaccination with unknown result. The outcome of the events was unknown. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of the events. Information on Lot/Batch number was available. Additional information has been requested.

20 2021-05-16 eye movement disorder Approximately three to four minutes after the second dose, he reported feeling dizzy. A few seconds ... Read more
Close
Approximately three to four minutes after the second dose, he reported feeling dizzy. A few seconds later he lost consciousness with eyes rolled to the back of his head. He was unresponsive to verbal communication or attempts to shake him awake. He then began grunting and struggling for breath. His body began to shake/convulse and he lost control of his bladder. This lasted about five to ten seconds. He regained consciousness and reported that he felt as if he was "dreaming". He also reported feeling very hot, and had sweat dripping down his face. Paramedics were called to the scene where his vital signs were checked. All signs including temperature were normal. His first dose on /26/21 had an almost exact reaction, minus losing control of bladder, although that time nobody was around to assist him.

20 2021-05-26 eye movement disorder ~10 seconds after administering the shot into the left deltoid, patient's eyes started to roll back,... Read more
Close
~10 seconds after administering the shot into the left deltoid, patient's eyes started to roll back, became unresponsive, and started falling back in the chair. This lasted for ~15 seconds. After this, the patient immediately regained consciousness, had no issues breathing, and was able to talk. Patient reported light-headed. 911 was called immediately upon reaction, first responders came in and took patient's BP and glucose. Glucose 91 mg/dL, BP was low (forget exact value), but returned to normal (~117/80) after about 10 minutes. Patient seemed fully conscious and aware, opted to not go to the hospital and signed a declination form of transport. First responders deemed that the patient was aware and did not necessarily need transport to the ER. Patient requested a ride home from friend/family member and is going home to rest.

Had redness and pain at injection site the whole time and other symptoms lasted 3 days.

Within 1 minute of the event the patient became very stiff, his eyes started to roll in the back of his head and he was unresponsive. Pt was placed in a wheelchair, full set of vitals obtained,sternum rub performed, cold compress applied to the forehead, and the nurse begin to ask a series of questions to try and keep the patient conscious. Headache; Soreness at vaccine site; Fever; Myalgias; Mouth ulcers; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable consumer, the patient. A 20-years-old male patient received first dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot number: UNKNOWN) via an unspecified route of administration in left arm on18Mar2021, at 08:30 AM as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included ADD and genetic inflammatory fever syndrome. It was reported that no allergies to medications, food or other products. Concomitant medications included FOCALIN and LEXAPRO. It was reported that, prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested positive for COVID-19. It was reported that the patient did not received any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. On 18Mar2021 at 14:00 the patient experienced mouth ulcers, headache, myalgia, fever and soreness at vaccination site. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of mouth ulcers, headache, myalgia, fever and soreness at vaccination with mortin (MANUFACTURER UNKNOWN). The clinical outcome of the events mouth ulcers, headache, myalgia, fever and soreness at vaccination site was resolving. Information about lot/batch number cannot be obtained. No further information is expected.

20 2021-07-08 visual impairment Patient asked to stay seated immediately following vaccination, as he has a needle phobia. Shortly a... Read more
Close
Patient asked to stay seated immediately following vaccination, as he has a needle phobia. Shortly after (roughly 5 minutes), patient said he felt extremely lightheaded and shaky. He accepted a glass of water, but after taking a few sips said his vision was starting to black in and out. 911 was called immediately. EMTs checked that patient's blood pressure and heart rate, and eventually concluded the patient was okay after giving him more water and a banana to eat.
20 2021-07-15 thirst Pt 20year old male- came to the pharmacy for a walk in covid vaccine. He filled out the vaccine co... Read more
Close
Pt 20year old male- came to the pharmacy for a walk in covid vaccine. He filled out the vaccine consent form. I asked him if he was feeling ok today - he said yes. he presented as looking in healthy condition. I then asked him if he has ever had a bad reaction to a vaccine and he said not that he knew of but that he did not like needles. I told him that was normal, explained the shot was a quick pinch no stinging and would be over before he knew it. I encouraged him to relax his arm muscle and as soon as he did I gave the vaccine. I started to tell him he could take Tylenol or ibuprofen if he should get a sore arm and to make sure he is drinking plenty of water as hydration helps our bodies- he then asked if he could have some water and then tilted his head back and was passed out for i'd say 4 seconds. I massaged his arm and neck as he became kinda ridged and talked him back. he was out for about 4 seconds. I yelled for our store co manager who happened to be close by to come to the pharmacy and call 911. When he regained consciousness he started to sweat. he said he felt cold and thirsty. I gave him some water to drink. I explained to him what had happened and told him that we had called 911 out of precaution. I discussed with him calling parents and he wanted to call himself - he made the call to his mom on his cell phone to have her come pick him up. EMS arrived in about 10 minutes. they said his blood pressure was really low 100/60 and wanted to take him in but the patient refused. he also refused getting his blood sugar tested as he now told us he was deathly afraid of any medical procedure. ems left. I offered him some more water and chips. he drank 2 full bottles of water and ate a small bag of chips. his mom showed up a few minutes later to drive him home- we explained to her what had happened.. I told her to monitor his blood pressure at home (she said she had a machine)she said she should have known better than to let him come alone as she knew he reacted bad to medical situations. He left about 30 minutes after he got his vaccine. walked out on his own needed no assistance.

Close
Left sided chest pressure (concern of myocarditis); Left sided chest pressure (concern of myocarditis); Left sided chest pressures, like a chest pain on the left side; Shortness of breath; Chills; Wasn't feeling good with joint pain; Wasn't feeling good with joint pain/Wasn't feeling good after he received the vaccine; Not feeling well; Whole time from the time he got the dose till now he is been not feeling good; Fatigued/Still feeling fatigued; A lot of congestion; Sick; Muscle injection site was painful, arm was sore; Arm pain, the site of injection was really painful; Muscle injection site was painful, arm was sore; Arm pain, the site of injection was really painful; He didn't looked good at all, he just looked white; Ear infection; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable other healthcare professional . A 20-years-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, formulation: Solution for injection, Batch/Lot Number: EW0178; Expiration Date: 31Aug2021), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left (at the age of 20-years-old) on 02Jun2021 as single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included asthma from an unknown date and ongoing. Concomitant medication(s) included salbutamol sulfate (PROAIR [SALBUTAMOL SULFATE]) taken for an unspecified indication, start and stop date were not reported. Nurse stated, Initially when he has a dose of the first dose like two three days after he was experiencing, he also had a muscle that was given, he had a muscle injection site was painful, that arm was sore that was given, but he also started experiencing shortness of breath and same left sided chest pressure and I called his pediatrician and that's why we are just watching him because it wasnt to the point where he was full blown shortness of breath, full blown chest pressure stayed last for a couple of days then getting it worst. But he had the chills, he had fatigue is still there and it started to subside and then couple days after since it subside, fatigue never left but then he started to get chills again and fatigue was even more pronounce and then started more congestion and then he has ear infection, which we took him to doctor 2 days ago and he has started antibiotics. So the whole time from the time he got the dose till now he is been not feeling good, so now with the antibiotics he is feeling a little better and on 04Jun or 05Jun, like Friday to Saturday he was expecting little shortness of breath and then he was having a little bit of left side chest pressure, he had the arm pain initially and the site of injection was really painful and then the fatigue probably started the same time Friday Saturday he just, he didn't looked good at all, he just looked white. The patient experienced left sided chest pressure (concern of myocarditis), like a chest pain on the left side, shortness of breath, chills on an wasn't feeling good with joint pain wasn't feeling good with joint pain/wasn't feeling good after he received the vaccine; not feeling well; whole time from the time he got the dose till now he is been not feeling good, fatigued/still feeling fatigued on an unspecified date, ear infection on 19Jun2021 and a lot of congestion, muscle injection site was painful, arm was sore; arm pain, the site of injection was really, muscle injection site was painful, arm was sore; arm pain, the site of injection was really painful, he didn't looked good at all, he just looked white on an unspecified date. The patient was treated with antibiotics for ear infection. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included sars-cov-2 test result: negative. Caller stated His sons next dose (of Pfizer COVID vaccine) is due Wednesday. But until now he has not been feeling good. I don't want to give him the vaccine when he's sick. Does that make a difference with the effectiveness if I delay the second dose and she heard people had worse side effects for the first few days with fevers, body aches, nausea, fever and subsided and then they take their 2nd dose and are better after the 2nd dose, also stated her sons symptoms were not acute, but is not sure if it is coincidental if his ear infection was due to the vaccine. The outcome of the events were reported as unknown.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and the plausible drug-event temporal association, a possible contributory role of the suspect product BNT162B2 to the development of event myocarditis cannot be totally excluded. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

20 2021-07-28 ear infection severe upper respiratory infection; ear infection; he sounds like a barking dog; coughing; This is a... Read more
Close
severe upper respiratory infection; ear infection; he sounds like a barking dog; coughing; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient's parent). A 20-year-old male patient received the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; lot number and expiration date not reported), via an unspecified route of administration on 25Jun2021 (in the afternoon, between 13:00 and 16:00, at the age of 20-years-old) at dose 1, single in the right arm for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history and concomitant medications were reported as none. The was reported that the reporter's son was scheduled to take the second dose of BNT162B2 either on 15Jul2021 or on 18Jul2021. However, the patient currently has an ear infection and a severe upper respiratory infection which started on Jul2021. Further reported that the patient sounds like a barking dog. The patient has been on amoxicillin and then went back to his doctor because the amoxicillin prescribed wasn't strong enough and the other antibiotic was already used up. The patient still has upper respiratory infection but has no fever now. The reporter down not want the patient to have the shot and have another problem. The reporter doesn't know if the events were due to the vaccine or maybe at the time the patient was starting to get the problem, it seems like it coincided. The reporter stated that the events started 3 weeks ago, on Jul2021. Currently, the ear infection was improving slightly. The patient went to work and was sent home since the co-workers were complaining that the patient was coughing which started on Jul2021. The patient's doctor won't let the patient come until he had a COVID test, so the patient went to urgent care, where the patient underwent a COVID-19 test on Jul2021 and saw a doctor there. About a week or later, the patient's doctor let him come since his COVID-19 test last Jul2021 was negative. The doctor saw the patient and because of no improvement of the patient's upper respiratory infection, the patient was put on steroids and was changed to stronger antibiotics. The reporter wanted to know if it was safe for the patient to take the second dose even if his symptoms are still ongoing. The events resulted in physician's office visit and therapeutic measures were given as a result of the events. Outcome of the event upper respiratory infection was not recovered, for ear infection was recovering, and for other events was unknown. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.

Lost sense of taste; Lost sense of smell; Whole body is sore; Rapid test came back positive for COVID; Rapid test came back positive for COVID; This is a spontaneous report from a Pfizer-sponsored program IBCC (Inbound Call Center for HCPs) via a contactable consumer (patient). A 21-year-old male patient received his first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Lot number: EK5730, expiration date: 31Mar2021), via intramuscular on 29Dec2020 07:40 at 0.3 mL, single dose on his left deltoid for covid-19 immunization. Medical history included allergic to wasp stings. There were no concomitant medications. The patient had no additional vaccines administrated on the same date and no prior vaccinations were received within 4 weeks. Caller on the line calling about the COVID Vaccine he received on 29Dec2020. The day after receiving it he woke up and had a loss of sense of smell on 30Dec2020 12:00. That afternoon he went to get tested and the rapid test came back positive for COIVD on 30Dec2020. He was now waiting on the other one, clarified to be the PCR test, the lab test. The next day he also lost his sense of taste on 31Dec2020 11:00 and his whole body feels sore on 30Dec2020 around noon. Transfer agent stated the caller needs to be transferred to Medical Information as he was scheduled to get the next shot on 19Jan2021 and he was calling to ask if he should proceed with that. It was reported that the patient works in a hospital (not an HCP). No emergency room was visited and no physician office was visited. The outcome of the event "rapid test came back positive for covid" was unknown, the outcome of the other events "lost sense of smell", "lost sense of taste", "whole body is sore" were not recovered.
21 2021-01-07 photosensitivity reaction Symptoms started during bedtime and woke me up. Began with severe full body chills and full body mus... Read more
Close
Symptoms started during bedtime and woke me up. Began with severe full body chills and full body muscle shaking and weakness during the night of 1/5 and early morning of 1/6, around 1000 to 0200. Slight headache began during that time as well. Upon waking at 0900 on 1/6, chills and shaking decreased to mild severity, muscles still felt moderately weak and shaky, headache had increased in severity to a severe throbbing pain that worsened upon standing and walking, and moderate visual photosensitivity began. The headache persisted until I took 2 tablets of ibuprofen 200 mg, which is when the severity decreased to moderate after a few hours and then mild by bedtime. The photosensitivity persisted through the day and did not decrease much by bedtime. Upon waking 1/7, there was only a mild headache and mild photosensitivity that faded completely within a few hours, no medication required. No more symptoms in the afternoon.

Close
Patient states that on day of vaccine, after receiving vaccine he felt tired, didn't feel well. Around 8pm that evening, he began having chills and didn't sleep well. On 19MAR, patient states he felt tired and vision got blurry while driving. Last thing he remembers is EMS personnel in ambulance stating that BP was very low. Patient states that while trying to brake prior to accident, he felt like he couldn't move his foot and stayed on the accelerator because he couldn't move his foot. MVA 19 Mar 2021. States following his COVID vaccination on 18 Mar, he had fevers, chills, and body aches that night and into the next day. While driving to work on 19 Mar at 0900, he struck another vehicle from behind while traveling 40mph. States his vision went blurry and he was unable to move his leg off the accelerator. He was wearing his seatbelt and the airbags deployed. Denies any LOC. He was taken via ambulance to. Imaging performed, as above, unremarkable. SM denies any issues today and feels well, besides neck pain. Unremarkable neurologic exam in clinic, no focal neuro deficits. MACE completed and showed a 2 point improvement from yesterday. Discussed importance of physical and mental rest, limit caffeinated products. Light indoor duty and no PT for next 3 days. Will f/u on Friday, 26 Mar 21.

21 2021-04-23 smell distorsion This is my second COVID Pfizer vaccine dose. After both dosages, a couple of days later, I began "sm... Read more
Close
This is my second COVID Pfizer vaccine dose. After both dosages, a couple of days later, I began "smelling" smells that weren't there. In my case, I was smelling "cigarette smoke" and "wood smoke" smells even though there were no cigarettes or wood burning in my vicinity. I had no health complications as a result, it was only slightly unpleasant at times. I did not seek treatment for this because it was a minor inconvenience and the issue went away after my first dose in a week. It hasn't been a week since my second dose but I assume it will go away similarly.

Close
started with soreness/stiffness in injection site, which I expected as it was how I reacted with the first shot. however, I then started experiencing mild dizziness/visual impairment (feeling like my vision was shifting or "glitching") that started around two hours after the shot, slow onset of sore/achy back muscles that hit peak pain at around 3am, and intense chills/shivers that started around 11pm, getting progressively worse as the night went on. Attempted to stop the chills by wrapping in several blankets, but only continued to feel colder and colder. Despite the chills starting around 11pm, fever did not present itself until around 1am, hitting 99.8°F by 1:30am. It was around this time that I took an ibuprofen and acetaminophen, which did not kick in until around 2:30am. Once the chills stopped, my hands and feet only got hotter, keeping me awake for an additional 2 1/2 hours.

21 2021-05-09 tunnel vision 21yoM states that on 25 March 2021, he noted 25 minutes after his 1st dose of Pfizer vaccines, he no... Read more
Close
21yoM states that on 25 March 2021, he noted 25 minutes after his 1st dose of Pfizer vaccines, he noted a throat tightness, feels tight, scratchy, noted a hoarse throat with some voice changes. He felt throat tightness made it hard to breath, he had associated lightheadedness, felt anxious, almost like a wheezing sound when breathed in and out in his upper neck. When he stood up, he did feel like he needed to hold onto something to steady himself, had some tunnel vision, improved with sitting down and closing his yes and taking deep breaths. He felt warm at the time, not cold or clammy. His friend said he looked ghostly white, no flushing, no hives, no angioedema. No sense of impending doom. He did take Zyrtec the day that he received the vaccine. He waited the 15 minutes after vaccine without symptoms, and had walked back to class by the time it started. Between the vaccine and symptoms onset, he denies eating anything, being stung by anything. He told a friend about his symptoms, and he returned to the hospital via base taxi arrived at ER. Symptoms were still occurring about 60 minutes after vaccination when he arrived at the ER. In the ER, he underwent exam, was given oral Benadryl. His symptoms of scratchy throat lasted for 2 days afterwards with some associated fatigue, post-nasal drip. He denies other symptoms. No fevers or chills. Small amount of pain and a ?knot? at the injection site the next day, but minimal according to the paitent. Denies hives, angioedema, SOB, wheezing, nausea/vomiting, no diarrhea, abdominal pain, nasal pruritus/congestion, ocuarl itching/redness, no syncope. No h/o vaccine reactions before. No h/o passing out before at all, specifically not to needles, blood draws, or vaccines before. No h/o venom or drug allergy. He does report a history of apple allergic reaction 1 year previous when eating a raw apple, felt his throat close within 15-30 minutes, no hives or other systemic symptoms. He took oral Benadryl and went to ER. He was given oral Benadryl, no Epipen. He followed up with his PCM regarding possible apple allergy and was told to avoid apples, but was never tested for apple allergy. Since then, when he drinks apple juice, his throat will start hurting, but otherwise, he has avoided raw and cooked allergies. He does report seasonal rhinitis symptoms that are worse in the fall. He takes allegra as needed to treat these symptoms. He is not carrying an Epipen currently
