21 2021-05-25 smell distorsion Sometime after getting the Pfizer vaccine I noticed that my private area, underarms, and some other ... Read more
Close
Sometime after getting the Pfizer vaccine I noticed that my private area, underarms, and some other things now smell of onion. At first I had thought that it was the drink (Clear American Sparkling Water: Peach Flavor) that was changing my scent because it smelled and tasted heavily of onion. However, my thinking changed when the other flavors of this brand smelled and tasted as they should. My family and friends are not aware of the scent and cannot smell nor taste it. I have also noticed the scent outside my apartment complex on campus. There are no wild onions growing outside, but I can smell the scent when I walk near certain flowers or bushes before it fades away. Upon returning home the scent is still there. Showering controls the scent, but it gets worse throughout the day and makes me very subconscious about how I smell. I do not consume onion on a weekly basis, so the vaccine is the only oddball in my daily diet, so I believe that it is the culprit for this change. I believe that it may have potentially altered my sense of smell opposed to my thinking of my body odor itself changing. I have spoken to my Nurse Practitioner and we've decided to play the waiting game, but she advised me to send in a notice of this to the CDC for additional help if possible.

21 2021-06-19 ear discomfort Overnight after shot just typical symptoms, some slight chills and next day just a little tired Day ... Read more
Close
Overnight after shot just typical symptoms, some slight chills and next day just a little tired Day 2 after shot, April 11th. Chest pain, squeezing in chest. Unusual but manageable and didn?t feel terrible otherwise,maybe slightly tired. Tried leaning forward to make feel better. Day 3 and 4 chest pain/heart squeezing continued and was bothersome and, went to Urgent Care this day April 13th. EKG was a little abnormal and told to follow up with a cardiologist and take Advil. The heart squeezing feeling continued. Early morning hours April 14th very sick, excessive shaking (no fever), extreme nausea, faint feeling, dry cough (laying on bathroom floor). Not much, if any chest pain at the time. Went to ER. Not much chest pain during ER visit but nauseous and shaking etc. Test were run. Told that the symptoms were a delayed reaction to the vaccine and to follow up with a cardiologist because possible abnormal EKG and to take Advil as needed. Overnight at home, no chest pain but an hour of the shaking and nausea returned but not as bad as before. Over next couple days the chest pain/squeezing, slightly shakes and light headedness would come and go and by 4-16 feeling pretty great. The heart feeling mildly at most in the background but not debilitating. Starting week of April 20th maybe 4-5 flare ups with chest pain and no pattern but not debilitating. Could happen at rest. April 27th bigger flare up more debilitating, had to lie down, heart squeezing pain and maybe some wheezing when breathed in but not tightness in throat. Lasted about 30 minutes. Was just doing schoolwork with friends at the time so not under any physical or emotional stress at the time. After this from April 20 to May 3rd feeling heart symptom mildly but not debilitating and could resume normal active life. Had cardiology appt. May 3rd with nurse practitioner. According to NP the 12 Lead EKG run that day correlated with abnormal EKG from ER. Normal sinus rhythm with sinus arrhythmia Rightward axis Pulmonary disease pattern. Incomplete right bundle branch block Abnormal ECG. Given 4 lead heart monitor to wear for a week. Also ordered a CV CT angiogram coronaries with calcium scoring. The test could not be scheduled through them until July. Also told could go on hiking trip out west and to stop and rest if felt pain. For parents reassurance about hiking trip, had a second opinion over teleconference call with Dr., myocarditis specialist to confirm would be safe on hiking trip. Dr. said he should be good to go. He said these heart symptoms related to the second vaccine could fade over time. Hiking trip May 20th to May 30th. Did fine with exertion and just a few small episodes of the chest pain, light headedness and maybe a little shaking but these were at rest. Also, 4 lead heart monitor report was good. Returned from trip May 30th and no chest pain or symptoms for approximately 3 weeks through June 17th. June 18th went to urgent care for sore throat and ear. Prescribed amoxycillin. Took the amoxycillin and one Advil sinus, that evening had a heart squeezing episode return. This was the first time in almost 3 weeks. Did not take any more Advil sinus in case that caused the episode. Had another slight episode that evening. Hiked next day June 19th and fine. Then felt it slightly again after eating that afternoon of the 19th, also chest did feel a little tight all day. Then felt it again that evening. Still taking Amoxycillin as of today.

Fast heartbeat; Anxiety; Nervousness; Stomach pain; Problems with his eyesight; Like stomach reactions like he is going to vomit but doesn't end up vomiting; Malaise; Headache; Fever; going to vomit but doesn't end up vomiting; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer or other non-healthcare professional (patient's father). A 21-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE solution for injection, Batch/Lot number was not reported), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in left arm on 07Jun2021 (21-year-old at the time of vaccination) as dose 2, single for covid-19 immunization. Medical history included not reported. The concomitant medications were none. The patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE solution for injection, Batch/Lot number was not reported), via an unspecified route of administration on an unspecified date on 2021 as dose 1, single for covid-19 immunization. On an unspecified date on 2021, the patient presented symptoms he had never had such as, fast heartbeat, malaise, anxiety, nervousness, headache, stomach pain, problems with his eyesight and fever. The patient had to be admitted into the emergency room, had several studies done and no abnormalities were diagnosed. The reporter stated that Pfizer covid vaccine on 07Jun2021. After the vaccine the patient had a fast heartbeat, general malaise, felt nervous, headache, a stomach-ache, and a fever. The patient had to go to the emergency room, and they performed tests and analysis on him and nothing came up. This event started about a week after the vaccine and his heart rate was speeding up. The heart rate and anxiety and headaches and like stomach reactions like he is going to vomit but doesn't end up vomiting. The symptoms are different on different days. The heart rate only happened once and everything has continued to happen. This happened after the second dose of the vaccine. They sent the patient from the emergency room to another place and admitted him for 2 days. The reporter is unsure of the dates of admission. They sent the patient to a hospital where there was a cardiologist and the patient stayed there for 2 days. As Per fact sheet, what are the risks of the Pfizer BioNTech covid-19 vaccine, revised: 25Jun2021, fast heartbeat is listed as one of the signs of a possible severe allergic reaction. Most of these side effects don´t have a mean duration documented, some of the side effects have a range of appearance from 1-36 days. The reporter asked for treatment recommendations for patient. The events were serious - hospitalization. The outcome for the event's fast heartbeat, visual impairment, abdominal discomfort, pyrexia, going to vomit but doesn't end up vomiting were unknown and other events were not resolved. Information about batch/lot number has been requested.

Client denied any other symptoms such as shortness of breath, chest pain, numbness or tingling of his mouth, tongue, and throat, dizziness or feeling lightheaded. Client denied any allergies to medications/foods/environment and stated he had no pertinent medical history nor did he take medications regularly. Client reported last oral intake was a cup of coffee in the morning before vaccination with last meal being dinner on 07/27/21. EMT took the client's vitals at 1106: BP 140/90, HR 70 skin color normal for ethnicity, warm and dry, A&Ox4. Client stated the feeling of cold running down his leg and his tense jaw had resolved. Client stated he had the same feeling after his first dose Pfizer COVID vaccine on 7/7/21. A second set of vitals were taken at 1115: BP 130/90, HR 69 skins normal for ethnicity, warm and dry, A&Ox4. Client stated the vitals were a little higher than his normal but attributed it to having coffee without food and feeling a little nervous. Client stated he felt better and the symptoms had resolved. Close
Within 1 minute of receiving vaccination, patient fainted - slumped in chair, clammy, and pale. Unresponsive to verbal stimuli. Eyes rolled back with some jerkiness in extremities. Resolved in about 1 minute. No respiratory distress. Became responsive to verbal stimuli and was alert and oriented. Drank one bottle of orange juice, and after 10 minutes of sitting, able to walk back to monitor area without issue. Observed another 20 minutes.

A 22-year-old male patient received second dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number=En5318), via an unspecified route of administration on 29Jan2021 11:30 (at 22-year-old) at single dose (Right arm) for COVID-19 immunization. The patient medical history was not reported. Patient had known allergies. Facility type vaccine was Public Health Clinic/Veterans Administration facility. No other vaccine was administered in four weeks. No other medications in two weeks. Patient had no covid prior to vaccination. The patient was covid tested post vaccination. There were no concomitant medications. The patient took first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number=El3248), on 08Jan2021 12:00 (at 22-year-old) on Right arm for COVID-19 immunization. It was reported that it started with soreness in the arm. Turned into horrible muscle and joint aches, pounding headache, an immense amount of pressure behind the eyes, and uncontrollable body aches. This lasted from about 12 hours and then got progressively better. By hour 48 he was totally fine. Events started on 29Jan2021 22:00. No treatment was received for events. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included covid test: Nasal Swab: negative on 31Jan2021. The outcome of the events was recovered.

Close
Around 10pm, I was suddenly very tired and could not stop yawning. I typically am up until 12-1 most nights so this was out of the ordinary. While getting ready for bed I became very nauseous and almost threw up. I had waves of nausea for around 20 minutes. When I stood up I had chills throughout my body and my skin was covered in goosebumps. A little later, my vision started to go black and I felt dizzy and light-headed. I went to bed shortly after in hopes of sleeping it off (probably 10:45-11). Around 2 am the following morning, I woke up and had a hot flash (could have been a fever but I did not check my temperature). I was able to fall back asleep and felt normal when I woke up at 7:30 am.

The patient experienced abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting and metallic taste in mouth on 07Mar2021 12:00 AM. Required hospitalization. The patient was hospitalized for the events for 3 days. The events resulted in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, emergency room/department or urgent care and hospitalization. Treatment was received for the events which included IV fluids, anti nausea medicine pain medication. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included Nasal Swab: negative on 12Mar2021. Close
The patient became pale and light headed within minutes of his vaccination. He also reported his vision dimmed. He reported he has a history of this reaction with any injection. We gave him water and took his blood pressure, it was initially 69/58 with a pulse of 46. Five minutes later it was 164/93 with a pulse rate of 41. Five minutes later it was back down to 82/50 with a pulse of 87. Five minutes later he was feeling better, his color and site normalized and his blood pressure was 117/70 with a pulse rate of 69. We let him sit for a while longer and when he was comfortable he got up, walked around, and left.

22 2021-04-28 vision blurred severe blurred vision; shortness of breath; shaking; stiffness in his jaws; patient who fainted; Thi... Read more
Close
severe blurred vision; shortness of breath; shaking; stiffness in his jaws; patient who fainted; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable pharmacist. A 22-year-old male patient received the first dose of bnt162b2 (BNT162B2, Solution for injection, Lot number was not reported), via an unspecified route of administration on an unspecified date (received at the age of 22-years-old) as SINGLE DOSE for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history SVT (supraventricular tachycardia) (diagnosed with SVT by his cardiologist, however it was never confirmed), palpitation, and had fainted in two different situations in the past. Concomitant medications were not reported. The patient fainted after the first dose of COVID-19 vaccine as soon as he stood up. He was unconscious for about 5 seconds. He was experiencing severe blurred vision, shortness of breath, shaking and stiffness in his jaws. He was 22 years old, 170 pounds, and 6 feet tall. He has history of palpitation. In the past he was diagnosed with SVT by his cardiologist, however it was never confirmed. In addition, he had fainted in two different situations in the past. Based on what the patient says, his health issues and why he faints was never fully understood by medical doctors. Outcome of the events was unknown. Information about Lot/batch number is requested.; Sender's Comments: A possible contributory effect of suspect BNT162B2 on event syncope cannot be excluded. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

Close
Within minutes of receiving covid-19 vaccine, I became very excessive sweaty (my shirt was wet), felt eyesight was dimming, space perception was completely off, very pale, dizziness and unable to hear when being spoken too, felt faint. Both of my arms had a very tingly feeling and felt heavy and then became completely numb and I was unable to move to either arm for approximately 45 minutes. Movement slowly came back throughout the evening and over the next week. My legs felt tingly and heavy. I continue to have periodic tingly feeling in my joints through out my body. My chest felt heavy. I felt like I was doing to die. Large red swollen area where shot was given. I have COVID 19 in Feb, 2021. Health care profession suspects the reaction may have been related to having COVID-19, second dose not recommended. Likely to have antibodies. I have not felt 100 percent since receiving vaccine.

Patient stated that he was starting to feel better but tongue still tingling. Paramedics arrived on site at 1545 and care turned over to them.

Close
loss of smell; Loss of taste; feeling like a sinus infection; pain at the injection site; muscle pain; Headache; Headache; This is a spontaneous report from a Pfizer-sponsored program. A contactable consumer (patient) reported that a 23-year-old male patient received first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Batch/lot number: EL3248, expiration date: Nov2021), via an unspecified route of administration on 11Jan2021 at 11:00 AM in the left deltoid at single dose for work as behavioral technician. Medical history included Chronic headaches predates his treatment with bnt162b2. Family Medical History was none. There were no concomitant medications. There were no prior vaccinations (within 4 weeks). Patient reported he got the first dose of the bnt162b2 on 11Jan2021. He noticed one and a half hours later (12:30) pain at the injection site and muscle pain; then 12Jan2021, the next day lost his sense of smell and taste and it felt like a sinus infection. Added he didn't know exactly what a sinus infection felt like but he felt like he had jumped into a pool without holding his nose. Added twelve later (on 12Jan2021) the muscle pain resolved; his injection site was still a little painful and he still couldn't smell or taste. He was planning to get the second dose of the vaccine on 03Feb2021. Added he took ibuprofen for a headache later the night of the vaccine 11Jan2021. He had headache multiple times a week. This headache started that day. After taking the ibuprofen his headache resolved that same day. There were not any events require a visit to physician or ER. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of events headache. No investigation assessment. The outcome of the event headache was recovered on 11Jan2021, muscle pain was recovered on 12Jan2021; outcome of events pain at the injection site and feeling like a sinus infection was recovering; outcome of the other events was not recovered.

23 2021-04-02 mouth tingling, swollen tongue Within five minutes of receiving the vaccine, my throat started swelling, my tongue started swelling... Read more
Close
Within five minutes of receiving the vaccine, my throat started swelling, my tongue started swelling, and my tongue starting tingling. I've had two allergic reactions before; this felt less severe, but otherwise similar. At 6:18 pm, I was given a shot of epinephrine, and started to feel better. After that, I went to an urgent care center. They took my vitals, and everything looked alright. They told me to take Benadryl and monitor the situation, which I did. As I type (3:30 pm, 21 hours and 45 minutes later), I feel back to normal again: perfectly fine.

23 y/o male with no PMH c/o dizziness ~10 min post pfizer vaccine 1st dose assoc with blurry vision. Pt was assessed by clinical leads/EMS. Pt never LOC, was attached to monitor, VS monitor, placed on stretcher, given H2O x 5 (250mL) + ice packs + cookies. Pt reported complete resolution of symptoms within ~4min. 3 lead showed irregular sinus arrythmia w/ peaked T waves. Pt was started on 20g IV on left hand 1L NS bolus with no change in EKG. Based on clinical judgement EKG changes dont appear to be a vaccine related adverse RXN, most likely a benign finding or electrolyte abnormality. Pt was advised to go to ER for further evaluation and management, pt agreed to transport to ER. Pt was advised to drink water and ea

23 2021-04-24 ear discomfort, eye discomfort not feeling well; he felt really terrible yesterday; Fatigue; on the left side of his throat, it hur... Read more
Close
not feeling well; he felt really terrible yesterday; Fatigue; on the left side of his throat, it hurt to swallow/throat pain; on the left side of his throat, it hurt to swallow/throat pain; last night (07Apr2021), he had a really bad headache; Sensation of pressure in ear; Sensation of pressure in eye; Dizzy on standing; at one point, he had a little bit of nausea with the dizziness; he was really weak; he didn't eat yesterday because he had no appetite; Chills/Teeth chattering; Shaking; Hot feeling generalized; Sweating; Feeling hot and cold; on Tuesday night (06Apr2021) he didn't sleep well, and he could barely sleep last night (07Apr2021); his head felt heavy on Tuesday night (06Apr2021), and his head felt super heavy last night (07Apr2021); This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient) via a Pfizer-sponsored Program COVAX US Support. A 23-year-old male patient received the second dose of bnt162b2 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Left arm on 27Mar2021 (between 11:55AM and 12:00PM) (Lot Number: ER8732; Expiration Date: Jul2021) as single dose for covid-19 immunisation. The patient medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient previously received the first dose of bnt162b2 via Intramuscular, at the age of 23-year-old, administered in right arm on 06Mar2021 (Lot Number: EN6206, Expiry: 30Jun2021) as single dose for covid-19 immunisation. He felt really terrible yesterday (07Apr2021). On Tuesday night (06Apr2021) he didn't sleep well, and he could barely sleep last night (07Apr2021). His head felt heavy on Tuesday night (06Apr2021), and his head felt super heavy last night (07Apr2021). On 07Apr2021, the patient experienced fatigue, on the left side of his throat, it hurt to swallow/throat pain, really bad headache, sensation of pressure in ear, sensation of pressure in eye, dizzy on standing, a little bit of nausea with the dizziness, really weak, he didn't eat yesterday because he had no appetite, chills/teeth chattering, shaking, hot feeling generalized, sweating, feeling hot and cold. The patient experienced not feeling well on an unspecified date. Patient started developing symptoms that were very bad, he thought he had COVID. Patient had a PCR test that was negative. Patient would like to know if a delayed response after second dose is normal. Reported he had received his second COVID-19 Vaccine dose about 2 weeks ago (27Mar2021). He said he felt really terrible yesterday. He said he felt so bad that he thought he had the COVID-19 Virus, and went to get tested. He clarified he had a real time COVID-19 Virus PCR test yesterday (07Apr2021), and received a negative result today (08Apr2021), less than 24 hours after having the test performed. He said it could be something else that was making him feel terrible. He said he had a (telehealth) appointment with a doctor tomorrow (09Apr2021). Caller asked if Pfizer had any data with the second COVID-19 Vaccine for people that had a really delayed immune response with their immune system. He said he had no symptoms after his second COVID-19 Vaccine, and was wondering if what he was experiencing now was a delayed immune response. Reported last night was the worst for his symptoms, saying it was awful. He said he felt better this morning. He clarified that on Tuesday night (06Apr2021) he didn't sleep well. He said his head felt heavy, but when he woke up, he did not feel too bad. He said he had fatigue, and on the left side of his throat, it hurt to swallow. He said last night (07Apr2021), he had a really bad headache, and his head felt super heavy. He said he had ear and eye pressure. He said he got dizzy on standing, and at one point, had a little bit of nausea with the dizziness. He said he wasn't sure if the nausea was caused by the dizziness. He said he was really weak, and didn't eat yesterday because he had no appetite. He said he took his temperature at around 8:00PM-9:00PM last night, and had no fever. He said he still had his sense of taste and smell. He said he had chills, he was shaking, and his teeth were chattering. He said he was also hot and sweating at times, like he was alternating between hot and cold. He said he tried to drink water yesterday, and would take a few sips of water when he turned over in bed. He said he could barely sleep. Treatment: Reported he took Ibuprofen 200mg tablets, off and on, to treat his headache because his headache was preventing him from sleeping. He said he would take 2 Ibuprofen 200mg tablets at a time. He said he took his first Ibuprofen dose in the middle of the night on Tuesday, and then took 2 more doses of 2 Ibuprofen 200mg tablets last night. He said he did not have the Ibuprofen 200mg tablet NDC, Lot, and Expiration Date because he had taken Ibuprofen from a different Ibuprofen 200mg bottle and put it in the Ibuprofen 200mg he was taking from. Reported he felt he had gained strength back today (08Apr2021) because he had showered this morning, and didn't fall over. He said he was so weak yesterday, even trying to text for his work was bad. He said his headache was a little worse today, and his left-sided throat pain was persisting, but everything else had subsided for now. Caller said he was wondering if what he had experienced was a delayed immune response, or a false negative COVID-19 Virus test, or something else, like Mono. Patient was not feeling well. Did test negative covid. The outcome of the event headache, Swallowing painful and Throat pain was not recovered, other events was recovering. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.

A 23-year-old male patient received his second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EW0170) at the age of 23-years-old, via an unspecified route of administration in right arm on 22Apr2021 at 14:00 at single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included being a smoker (he vapes). The patient's sister has Addison's disease. There were no concomitant medications; no additional vaccines administered on the same date as BNT162B2 and there were no prior vaccinations within 4 weeks. The patient previously received his first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EB8733) at the age of 23-years-old, via an unspecified route of administration in right arm on 01Apr2021 at single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The patient received the second dose of the COVID vaccine on 22Apr2021 at 14:00. He woke up on 23Apr2021 and felt like he had sinus pressure, then he blew his nose and had a bit of a nosebleed. He also felt like he could taste blood in his throat and mouth. The nosebleed stopped, but there was still some pressure in his sinuses. He asked if he needed to go to the hospital. He has a headache and it seemed like a sinus headache. It was more on the right side where he had the nosebleed. He could still kind of taste a little bit of blood in his mouth and throat. There were no relevant tests, but he was trying to figure out if it's needed. The events did not require emergency room or physician office visit. He was not hospitalized but he was trying to decide if he needed to go to the hospital. The outcome of the event nose bleed was recovered on 23Apr2021 and not recovered for all other events. No follow-up attempts are possible; information about lot/batch number cannot be obtained. Follow-up (23Apr2021): New information from a contactable consumer (patient) includes: patient details, medical history, historical vaccine, therapy details, reaction data ("Can taste blood in his throat and mouth" and "has a headache and it seems like a sinus headache" were added; outcome and onset were updated), and course of events.

23 2021-06-10 vision blurred I am healthy 23 year old male. I have never suffered from any sort of illness or conditions. After m... Read more
Close
I am healthy 23 year old male. I have never suffered from any sort of illness or conditions. After massive push by the goverment and incentivization to take the New Covid-19 Vaccines deemed safe , I went ahead and received the Pfizer shot on 05/24/2021. A day after I felt headache and dizziness. This stopped on the third day. Later I would have episodes of blurred vision. That stopped. But what has really affected me and continues to affect me , is that a week after I have developed major difficulty breathing. I never , ever not even once in my life have suffered from breathing problems. It all started on an afternoon a week after the shot randomly with really fast heart palpitations and after those palpitations stopped I was choking, I could not breathe at all. After this , I am having trouble breathing normally or getting enough air in along with tightness in the chest area. For instance, I struggle with two breaths and then the third I will likely get more air in. I have felt incredible tightness in my chest. There has been nights where I cannot sleep because I am unable to breathe , and feel like I am choking. So , I need to get up and walk around the house to catch my breath. I am having shortness of breath and my breathing is not like it used to be. I do not have any fever or any other symptoms , the persisting problem is the tightness and difficulty breathing. I already went to the Pulmonary doctor a couple days ago and underwent testing that are pending. I do not understand why this happened to me , I am not sure if it is a coincidence or if there is a relation between me having taken that Pfizer shot . But prior to taking that vaccine I never once had trouble with my breathing and never felt tightness around my chest. This is new to me and it scares me to think this might stay with me forever, whatever it is. I pray it goes away. I am still having trouble . and the fact that in the past I never thought about my breathing because it was normal, and now it is a constant issue throughout the day, moments when I can get air and others when it is very difficult. I am reporting this to leave a record of this incident because prior to me taking this vaccine , I was in fact a fully healthy person free of any sort of health issues.
23 2021-06-11 vision blurred Client reported feeling like he was going to "pass out" and had blurry vision. Client lost conscious... Read more
Close
Client reported feeling like he was going to "pass out" and had blurry vision. Client lost consciousness for approximately 5 seconds and was assisted into gravity chair for observation. Client was provided bottled water and education on vaccine side-effects. Client was advised to seek emergency medical attention, but refused. Client was advised to follow-up with primary care provider. Client left site unassisted with steady gaitafter approximately 40 minutes observation with mother, who advised she will take client to urgent care or emergency room if symptoms persist.

23 2021-06-23 vision blurred Client's companion alerted EMT client was not feeling well. EMT informed PHN. Upon arrival at 1736 c... Read more
Close
Client's companion alerted EMT client was not feeling well. EMT informed PHN. Upon arrival at 1736 client sitting in chair, pale and diaphoretic. Client alert and oriented x4. EMT performed vitals at 1736: blood pressure 140/90, pulse 59, oxygen sat 100%. PHN began assessment. Client reported blurry vision, shortness of breath and feeling "very hot all over body". Client denies throat closing, no flushing noted, no swelling noted. Client diaphoretic, shirt soaked, arms and legs. Client pale and lips pale. Client reported has history of fainting with blood draws, no current medications and no known allergies. At 1740 client reports feeling "I can't take a full breath", pulse 43. PHN calls 911 at 1740. PHN and PHN observed client using upper muscles to take breaths. PHN auscultated clear lung sounds. 1743 weak pulse, 54. Client diaphoretic, alert and oriented x4. Client reports new onset of headache at. Vitals at 1744: blood pressure 130/80, pulse 56, oxygen sat 99%. At 1747 manual pulse 58. Fire Department arrived at 1748 and assumed care. Client signed AMA and walked out of facility at 1754 immediately after Fire Dept leaves.

within a minute of the shot (2nd of the series) patient reported graying/reddening of vision and weakness/fainting - sat on ground - drank water - ate cookies - over 10 minutes patient felt better - EMT came in and checked him out - bp at that time 108/60 pulse 60 - blood sugar 66 - after 10 minutes tried to stand - felt weak and dizzy again - vision disturbed again - bp 110/70 - EMT suggested hospital - patient went to hospital
23 2021-06-29 dry eye Fever; his confusion started at 4:00AM today; he had bad diarrhea from 4:00AM-5:30AM.; his dry eyes ... Read more
Close
Fever; his confusion started at 4:00AM today; he had bad diarrhea from 4:00AM-5:30AM.; his dry eyes started around 12:00PM yesterday; his stomach started to hurt between 8:30-9:00PM last night; He had muscle spams last night; not feeling well; his first Pfizer BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine shot was in his left deltoid, and his left upper arm hurt; he couldn't sleep last night; about 4:00PM yesterday (4-7 hours after getting his Pfizer BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine), he was feeling weird, and it had gotten worse; his heart beat was fast and his heart rate was up to 120bpm last night; his blood pressure was 160/98; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer or other non hcp (patient). A 23-year-old male patient received first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Formulation: Solution for injection), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Deltoid Left on 16Mar2021 09:30 (Batch/Lot Number: EU6204; Expiration Date: 30Jun2021) as dose 1, single (age at vaccination 23-year-old) for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included ongoing attention deficit hyperactivity disorder Verbatim: ADHD , ongoing Blood pressure high ,anxiety, insomnia, muscle spasms, Panic attacks ,DUI accident , septorhinoplasty from 2020 to an unknown date. Reported he was prescribed Lyrica due to a DUI accident , rhinoplasty from 2020 to an unknown date He said he had a septorhinoplasty a year ago. Concomitant medications included gabapentin, carisoprodol ,bisoprolol fumarate (ZEBETA), amfetamine aspartate, amfetamine sulfate, dexamfetamine saccharate, dexamfetamine sulfate (ADDERALL) taken for an unspecified indication, start and stop date were not reported. The patient previously took trintellix for antidepressant therapy and experienced drug ineffective, trintellix for antidepressant therapy and experienced constipation, trintellix for antidepressant therapy and experienced nausea, clonazepam and experienced heart rate decreased. On16Mar2021, the patient experienced about 4:00pm yesterday (4-7 hours after getting his pfizer biontech covid-19 vaccine), he was feeling weird, and it had gotten worse, his heart beat was fast and his heart rate was up to 120bpm last night, his blood pressure was 160/98, his blood pressure was 160/98, his first Pfizer BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine shot was in his left deltoid, and his left upper arm hurt, he couldn't sleep last night, his dry eyes started around 12:00PM yesterday, his stomach started to hurt between 8:30-9:00PM last night, Fever, He had muscle spasm last night and on 17Mar2021, patient experienced that his confusion started at 4:00AM today, he had bad diarrhea from 4:00AM-5:30AM. It was reported, He was diagnosed with ADHD between 2012-2014. He said he took a generic Adderall 20mg Immediate Release tablet, twice a day (20mg in the morning & 20mg at 2:00PM). He said he had been on Adderall for about 8 years. His muscles spasms were from a prior accident he had. He said he was hit by a car going 48mph while he was riding his bicycle. He got the Pfizer BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine shot yesterday (16Mar2021). He said he was not feeling well. He said about 4:00PM yesterday (4-7 hours after getting his Pfizer BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine), he was feeling weird, and it had gotten worse. He said his heart beat was fast, he had high blood pressure, his stomach hurt, he had muscle spasms, he could not sleep, he had diarrhea, a fever, dry eyes, and left upper arm pain. He said he was normally healthy, and did not have the COVID-19 Virus before. He said he wanted to report his symptoms to Pfizer. He had ADHD and high blood pressure. He clarified he took his blood pressure last night and his blood pressure was 160/98. He said he took his blood pressure medication, Zebeta, and his anxiety medicine, Clonazepam, at the same time last night. He said he takes Zebeta (Bisoprolol Fumarate) for his high blood pressure. He said he takes 1/2 of a Zebeta 5mg tablet (2.5mg) once a day, as needed, a few times a week when his blood pressure was high. He said the Zebeta was not like Propranolol. He said his blood pressure was fine. He said the Zebeta also lowered his heart rate. He clarified he takes Zebeta and all his other medications at the same time, and that his heart rate may have been lowered by the Clonazepam he took. He said he takes a Clonazepam 0.5mg tablet twice a day. He said he normally takes 1mg Clonazepam, but can take a Clonazepam 0.5mg tablet, as needed. He stated he had been taking the Clonazepam for as long as Adderall. He said he started taking Adderall first. He clarified he started taking Clonazepam for bad nightmares. He said he had tried all other types of medications for his nightmares. He said he started the Clonazepam in 2014 for his bad nightmares, and now the Clonazepam was prescribed for anxiety and panic attacks. He said he sees a therapist once a week. He said he checked his "pulse ox" last night, and his pulse ox was good. He said his heart rate was up to 120bpm last night. He said he kept a watch on his heart rate, and his heart rate was around 100-110, which was higher than normal. He said his heart rate was still elevated while he was laying down, stating his current heart rate was 113bpm. He said when he exercised his heart rate normally goes up to between 140-160bpm. Clarified he woke up at 4:00AM this morning (17Mar2021) with diarrhea. He said he had bad diarrhea from 4:00AM-5:30AM. He said he ate something for breakfast and took a fiber gummie. He said the fiber gummie would help harden his stool, and he did not want to take anything to cause constipation. He said he had not had diarrhea since about 5:30AM. He provided the fiber gummie product information as: Fiber Well Fit Supplement 5grams fiber. He had a fever. He stated he was going to check his temperature while he was speaking with the Pfizer agent, but did not provide his body temperature. He clarified a weird symptom he experienced after getting the Pfizer BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine was dry eyes. He said his dry eyes started around 12:00PM yesterday (16Mar2021). He said he bought Liquid Tears eye drops that were either (Company name) brand or (Company name) brand. He said the Liquid Tears was a saline eye drop with no medication in it. His stomach started to hurt between 8:30-9:00PM last night. He said he had a normal dinner and had taken his daily medications at 6:00PM yesterday. He was confused, too. He clarified his confusion started at 4:00AM today (17Mar2021). He said he did not charge his phone overnight, which was not normal, and a lot of other weird things. He said he knows it was not his medications causing his confusion because he had not started any new medications. He said he had been taking the same medications for quite some time. He got everyone (his mother and father) signed up for the COVID-19 Vaccine, and he was the only one experiencing issues. He was prescribed Lyrica due to a DUI accident, saying he knows Lyrica was a Pfizer medication. He clarified he was on Gabapentin first. He said he was on the maximum dose of Gabapentin (either 2000mg or 6000mg) in 2016. He said he was then was put on Lyrica. He said the Lyrica did not work as well as the Gabapentin. He clarified the Lyrica 75mg was stronger than the Gabapentin, and he didnot like how tired he was while taking the Lyrica 75mg. He said he took the Lyrica 75mg for a month or 2, and then was put back on Gabapentin. He said he was no longer taking either the Gabapentin or Lyrica. He said it was 6-7 years ago that he had taken Lyrica 75mg. He said he knew beforehand what the COVID-19 Vaccine side effects were, like chills, but diarrhea was not on the list of COVID-19 Vaccine side effects. He was not immunosuppressed. He said he had a septorhinoplasty a year ago. He could not sleep last night. He said he had diarrhea. He said his arm (left) hurts, but he does not care about that. He clarified he had his first Pfizer BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine shot in his left deltoid, and his left upper arm hurt. He said his left upper arm felt worse than getting a tetanus shot. He said he had really sensitive skin, and was white as a ghost. He said he did not have any swelling on his left upper arm and had put ice on his left upper arm earlier. He said he know, and intramuscular shot takes a few hours to get into the blood stream, and he did not know if the Pfizer BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine passed through the blood brain barrier. He had muscle spams last night. He clarified he had the muscle spasms prior to the Pfizer BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine. He said the muscles spasms were from a prior accident he had. He said he took one SOMA (Carisoprodol) last night (16Mar2021), clarifying the Carisoprodol was prescribed for his muscle spasms. He said he was prescribed a low dose of Carisoprodol for his muscle spasms. He said he usually takes Carisoprodol 250mg tablet up to twice a day (250mg at midday & 250mg at night). He said he had been taking Carisoprodol for 3 years. He said he took the 1 Carisoprodol 250mg tablet with the Zebeta (beta blocker) last night and he had no crazy muscle spasms. He said the Carisoprodol was dispensed in a pharmacy bottle and didn't have the NDC, Lot and Expiration Date listed. He had a complete blood panel a few months ago, and everything was fine. He had anxiety, ADHD and insomnia, saying that was why the takes his medications. He stated he did not take his Adderall this morning. He said he takes a generic Adderall 20mg Immediate Release tablet, twice a day (20mg in the morning & 20mg at 2:00PM). He said he had been on Adderall for about 8 years. He said the generic Adderall 20mg Immediate Release tablet was dispensed in a pharmacy bottle and had no NDC, Lot & Expiration Date listed. He does not drink coffee, and wanted to make sure that was noted on the report. He takes an Amitriptyline 50mg tablet at night. He stated he has been taking Amitriptyline 50mg for about 3-4 years. He said the Amitriptyline 50mg was dispensed in a pharmacy bottle, and he does not have the NDC, Lot, and Expiration Date. He said before the Amitriptyline, he used to take a Trintellix 20mg tablet once a day. He said the Trintellix 20mg was made by Takeda and was a terrible anti-depressant. He said he took Trintellix for about a year and a half, and the Trintellix did not do too much, he said the Trintellix was not working. He said the Trintellix gave him terrible constipation and nausea. He said he still had 4 Trintellix manufacturers bottles at his father house. He said the Trintellix 20mg was probably expired, and he had kept the Trintellix 20mg because it cost about $500 a bottle. He could not take SSRIs, like Paxil, Sertraline, and Lexapro. He said the SSRIs caused problems like sexual dysfunction. He said he does not have the NDC Number, Lot Numbers, and Expiration Dates for the SSRIs he used in the past. He said he was still with his pediatrician at the time he was taking SSRIs, and had since thrown out all his SSRI prescription bottles. He had some questions about the ingredients in the Pfizer BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included blood pressure measurement: 160/98 on 16Mar2021 , heart rate:100-110, heart rate:113, heart rate: 140 on an unknown date, heart rate: 120 on 16Mar2021 bpm , complete blood panel: everything was fine on an unknown date, oxygen saturation: good on 16Mar2021. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of events includes Gabapentin, Carisoprodol, Clonazepam, Zebeta, Adderall. The clinical outcome for events his heart beat was fast and his heart rate was up to 120bpm last night, he had bad diarrhea from 4:00AM-5:30AM, his dry eyes started around 12:00PM yesterday was recovering and outcome for events hypertension, his stomach started to hurt between 8:30-9:00PM last night, Fever ,feeling unwell was unknown while rest of events was not recovered. Description of Product Complaint: He was on Gabapentin, and then was put on Lyrica. He said the Lyrica did not work as well as the Gabapentin. He clarified the Lyrica 75mg was stronger than the Gabapentin, and he did not like how tired he was while taking the Lyrica 75mg. He said he took the Lyrica 75mg for a month or 2, and then was put back on Gabapentin. He said he was no longer taking either the Gabapentin or Lyrica. He said he had taken the Lyrica 75mg 6-7 years ago, and he no longer had the prescription to provide the Lyrica NDC, Lot, and Expiration Dates. He said in 2016 he was on the maximum dose of Gabapentin, and no longer had the Gabapentin NDC, Lot, and Expiration Date. He used to take a Trintellix 20mg tablet before he started taking Amitriptyline 50mg. He stated the Trintellix was a terrible anti-depressant. He said he took Trintellix for about a year and a half, and the Trintellix did not do too much. He said the Trintellix was not working. He said the Trintellix gave him terrible constipation and nausea. He said the Trintellix was dispensed in a manufacturer bottle, and he did not have the NDC, Lot, and Expiration Date to provide. He said he still had 4 Trintellix manufacturer bottles at his fathers house. He said the Trintellix was probably expired, and he had kept the Trintellix because it cost about $500 a bottle. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.

Fatigue; Ear pain; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable consumer, the parent. A 23-year-old male patient received first dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot number: P6955) in the left arm via an unspecified route on 20Mar2021 at 11:30 as a single dose (at the age of 84-years-old) for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient had no known allergies. Medical history included ADHD. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was diagnosed with COVID-19. Concomitant medications were not reported. The patient did not receive any other vaccination within four weeks prior to the COVID-19 vaccine. The patient did not receive any other medications within two weeks of vaccination. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. On 21Mar2021 at 12:00, the patient had fatigue and ear pain. The events not resulted in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, and emergency room/department or urgent care. The patient did not receive any treatment for the events. The clinical outcome of the events fatigue and ear pain was recovered on an unknown date. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.

I GAVE HIM AN ICE PACK, AND THEN WAS PREPARING TO LAY HIM ON THE GROUND. HE PASSED OUT, BUT DID NOT FALL AS WE LEANED HIM BACKWARD IN THE CHAIR.HE WAS UNCONSCIOUS FOR ABOUT 30 SECONDS. HE THEN BEGAN TO REGAIN CONSIOUSNESS AND WAS RESPONSIVE AND ANSWERED QUESTIONS APPROPRIATELY. WE GAVE HIM ORANGE JUICE AND BOTTLED WATER AND OBSERVED HIM FOR 40 MINUTES. Close
Ear infection; Ear was slightly tender; Scrating caused it to become inflamed; Ear hurts; Ear is now filled with fluids; This is a spontaneous report from a non-contactable consumer, the patient. A 23-year-old male patient received BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot number: ER8732), via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 24Mar2021 (at the age of 23-year-old), as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history was not reported. The patient had no allergies to medications, food, or other products. Concomitant medications included minoxidil (ROGAINE) and multivitamin (MANUFACTURER UNKNOWN); both taken for unknown indication from an unknown date. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient had been tested for COVID-19. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within four weeks prior to the vaccination. On 27Mar2021 at 20:00 the patient experienced ear infection. The patient did not leave the house and had not interacted with anyone. The patient noticed that ear was slightly tender and had agitated by scratching which caused it to become inflamed. The patient reported that ear was filled with fluids and that it hurt. The patient experienced ear infection frequently when patient had cold, and thought the vaccine made his body to react in the same way. On 29Mar2021, the patient was tested for COVID-19 virus test which resulted in negative. The adverse event resulted in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of ear infection, tenderness, inflammation, ear pain and fluid in middle ear which included treatment with amoxicillin (MANUFACTURER UNKNOWN). The clinical outcomes of the events ear infection, tenderness, inflammation, ear pain and fluid in middle ear were resolving at the time of this report. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.

Patient started developing throat swelling, shortness of breath, and paresthesia of the left upper extremity and neck approximately 10-15 minutes after receiving the first dose of the Pfizer Covid Vaccine. Visual examination detected slight facial and periorbital swelling but no posterior oropharyngeal edema. Patient was slightly hypertensive (150/93) and tachycardic (105 bpm) upon arrival in the ED. Patient had no rash or urticaria. Diphenhydramine 50 mg, famotidine 20 mg, and lactated ringers administered IV. Patient was observed for several hours in the ED, and discharged in stable condition.

24 2021-04-01 ear discomfort On Friday, April 4, 2021 client (DOB 5/3/1996) received his first dose of Pfizer COVID vaccine (LOT... Read more
Close
On Friday, April 4, 2021 client (DOB 5/3/1996) received his first dose of Pfizer COVID vaccine (LOT # EW0150, EXP 7/2021) at approximately 12:56pm. Per EMT report: at 1:06pm, client fell out of chair, landed on his left knee and regained consciousness immediately. Upon assessment, client stated his left knee pain was a 3 out of 10 scale. At 1:07pm, client was sat in the zero-gravity chair in supine position and given a bottle of water. Client stated he "felt pressure in ears-mainly right ear." EMT & 2nd EMT coached client to breathe normally. At 1:09pm vitals were taken: BP: 120/70, HR: 52, RR: 10, O2 sat: 95%, skin: pale, moist, cool, eyes: PERRLA, LOC: A&O x4. Lead RN was notified and advised vitals be taken every 5 minutes for an additional 30 minutes. At 1:13pm vitals were retaken: BP: 120/70, HR: 69, RR: 12, O2 sat: 94%, eyes: PERRLA, skin, pale, moist, cool, LOC: A&O x4. On assessment, client stated he has no history of fainting, no allergies, and not taking any medication. Client stated he had a small amount of food and water intake and was not currently experiencing nausea. At 1:20pm, client stated the pressure in his ear subsided and was experiencing no headache, light-headedness or dizziness. At 1:25pm vitals were retaken: BP: 120/70, HR: 69, O2: 98%, skin: warm, pink, dry, LOC: A&Ox4. At 1:35pm, vitals: BP: 120/78, HR: 72, RR: 12, O2: 96%. Client was lowered to sitting position in gravity chair. No changes in vital signs were assessed by EMTs. At 1:40pm one final set of vitals were taken: BP: 120/76, HR: 66, RR: 13, O2 sat: 97%, eyes: PERRLA, A&O x4, skin: pink, warm & dry. At 2:15pm, client was able to safely stand up. No further interventions indicated. Client was educated by Lead RN & EMT on signs and symptoms of adverse reactions and when to go to the ED/call MD. Client was also encouraged to sign-up. Client left vaccination site at approximately 2:15pm with a steady gait. A family member was able to pick him up and drive him home.

Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine EUA Full-body muscle tightness, Extreme Full-body pain, delirium, violent shaking, fever of 105 F, Extreme shortness of breath, vision impairment. All adverse effects lasted for approximately four hours Ambulance would have been called but inability to move/speak prevented call for help

He said while sitting in a chair waiting during the 15minutes post vaccination he started feeling queasy and wanted some water to drink. After standing up he felt dizziness that persisted While walking towards the pharmacy he fell forward flat on the floor . He said his hearing had gone out and it was muffled. He was assisted up into a chair . He was given water and crackers. After drinking water and eating the crackers he felt okay enough to leave after 30 minutes. He was walked to the foot where his ride was waiting in the parking lot. He had dinner but had not had his breakfast as at the vaccination time.

24 2021-04-17 eye irritation Significant fogginess of brain which has only worsened and is still lingering to now (4/18/21). Simu... Read more
Close
Significant fogginess of brain which has only worsened and is still lingering to now (4/18/21). Simultaneously this is mixed with fatigue regardless of how much sleep I get or water that I drink. Less frequently I have symptoms like eyes burning (similar to bad allergies), slight dizziness, minor headaches, and minor body aches. The fatigue and brain fog are by far the worst and still persist, the others listed are minor but still come and go in small amounts. On Wednesday (4/14) I took Zyrtec (10mg tablet) to help focus throughout the day then one ibuprofen tablet (200mg) at night, and on Friday (4/16) I only took the Zyrtec. Since then I have not taken any medications. The symptoms were alleviated by the medication but without them all symptoms come and go to varying degrees throughout the day and worsen by night time.

Close
Patient was administered his first dose of Pfizer at 0955 was sent to regular observation unit after administration where EMS staff noted patients girlfriend leaning over to shake him then she began screaming for help as patient had become unresponsive to her. Patient was in the passenger seat of the vehicle when EMS staff arrive to the vehicle patient was unresponsive to commands and was showing signs of possible seizure like activity. Staff in observation called for charge nurse and notified 911 for further evaluation by county EMS staff. Patient BP 144/92, Sats 94% R/A. Patient did began to wake up and stated he could not see anything everything was black staff attempted to keep the patient calm until EMS arrived on the scene. EMS/Fire department arrived at 10:05am per the chief EMS officer patient had a syncopal episode all vitals were stable at this time and patient refused to be transported to the ER for further evaluations. Charge nurse stated to patient i would feel more comfortable if you stayed on site for at least 30 mins prior to leaving the site and education was given in the even the patient has another syncopal episode after leaving the site today. Patient left site at 10:45am with girlfriend in the driver seat. Patient was stable and verbalized understanding of education provided he was alert and oriented at time of dismissal from the site.

Took patient's blood pressure, elevated his legs as I couldn't move him safely at the time, gave him water to drink, applied cool compresses to neck and forehead. Patient was observed by a clinic staff member during entire event. Rechecked patient's blood pressure 5 minutes later at resolution of symptoms. After recieving the second dose of Pfizer-BioNtech COVID-19 vaccine 48 hours ago; My sensitivity to test and smell has significantly decreased. I still cannot smell food or other scents from a distanc; I cannot taste the food as well as before the vaccination; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (Patient, self-reported). A 24-years-old male patient received second dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Solution for injection, Batch/Lot Number: EL9264) via an unspecified route of administration on Arm Right on 04Feb2021 10:30AM at single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The patient Medical history included patient cannot taste the food before vaccination. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. The patient had no allergies. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The Patient did not receive other vaccines in four weeks. The patient previously received the first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Solution for injection, Batch/Lot Number: EL3248) via an unspecified route of administration on Arm Right on 14Jan2021 05:30 PM at single dose for COVID-19 immunization. On 05Feb2021 09:00AM, after receiving the second dose of pfizer-biontech covid-19 vaccine 48 hours ago; the patient experienced sensitivity to test and smell has significantly decreased and still cannot smell food or other scents from a distance and have to smell up close. Patient cannot taste the food as well as before the vaccination. The patient did not receive any treatment for the events. The Outcome of the events was recovering. Follow-up (07May2021): Follow-up attempts completed. No further information expected.

About three minutes after the shot was injected, I started getting cold sweats. About two minutes after that I started to hear a ringing in my ears. This ringing got louder over the course of a minute and eventually my hearing was completely gone and I could only hear the ringing loudly. Had second pfizer vaccine Saturday 05/08/2021, noticed a blurred spot in central VA Monday. Intraretinal, no leak, no CNV or vasculitis. White center, Probable incomplete retinal blockage versus Roth spot. Endocarditis unlikely but check for heart murmur, echo if murmur. See PCP for systemic eval - check CBC w diff (for hematologic dis), coags for both hyper and hypo coagulable state as has been reported post COVID-19 vaccine. Also check for DM, HTN, although unlikely.

The patient had mild lip swelling, and tongue felt funny 15 to 20 minutes after their 1st dose. The patient was asked to sit for a few minutes longer to monitor but said they were okay and went home. It was recommended to have Benadryl on hand in case they needed it, and if any of his symptoms worsened at all to go to the hospital. I called and followed up with patient 1 & 1/2 hour after his shot and he was feeling much better and had taken a dose of Benadryl. He was again advised to monitor for any more signs or symptoms of lip/tongue/throat swelling and to seek medical attention if was having any of these symptoms. He also was advised to follow up with his PCP to see if he should get his 2nd dose or hold off due to the reaction he experienced.

The patient regained consciousness and was moved to the vaccination room and put feet up for evaluation. The patient loss consciousness for 10 more seconds. Vitals were taken immediately (see below) and patient was interviewed for adr's. Patient had extreme diaphoresis, said he had no diplopia but did have blurred vision . Patient said his head hurt and was given 500 mg apap for one dose. He said his ears were hot. Patient said he had no pain other than his head hurting. Patient had no uticaria or redness . 24 2021-06-02 ringing in ears Felt sick/slightly feverish 12 hours after shot, hard to sleep. Day after shot was mostly normal, th... Read more
Close
Felt sick/slightly feverish 12 hours after shot, hard to sleep. Day after shot was mostly normal, though a little under the weather. After another day, all cold symptoms were gone. Tinnitus in the right ear started 3 days after 2nd Pfizer COVID shot. Initially was only audible at night, when sleeping in a quiet room, but after 2 days became audible during day. Tinnitus presented as a high pitched steady ringing in the ear. Triggered intense anxiety and perception of the tinnitus increased to almost debilitating levels. Mental health counseling and prescription of daily amitriptyline to help with sleep and lorazepam to take as needed for anxiety has helped cope with tinnitus and associated mental aspects. Ringing still persists after almost four weeks after it started, but is perceived to be less loud now.

3 weeks later he developed Tinnitus/Tinnitus was reported as worsened; cannot sleep; headache; anxiety; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. A 24-years-old male patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, formulation: Solution for injection, lot number: ER8729, patient was 24 years old at the time of vaccination), via an unspecified route of administration in Arm Left on 17Apr2021 at 13:00(Patient age at time of vaccination: 24 years) as a single dose for covid-19 immunisation at pharmacy. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. There was no Family Medical History Relevant to AEs. There was no Prior Vaccinations (within 4 weeks) and no associated AEs following prior vaccinations. The reporter stated that patient gets a flu shot every year and is ok. The patient experienced tinnitus 3 weeks later. Upon follow up (11-may-2021), it was reported that on 06May2021, the patient experienced slight side effect in his ear like Tinnitus, Cannot sleep (ongoing), ongoing Headache, ongoing Anxiety and seriousness for Tinnitus was reported as worsened, whereas reporter seriousness for all other events was unspecified. The patient tinnitus did not stop for 5 continuous days and sounds like tinnitus all the way. The patient visited the ENT on 10May2021 and the patient's ear was clear and there was no other physical damage whatsoever to the patient's ear and he did not have any problems in his ear before vaccinating with the Covid-19 vaccine. The reporter reported that the patient's tinnitus seems like it's louder and sound is very low and that the patient cannot do low sounds. The patient anxiety and headache are from the tinnitus. The reporter unable to provide NDC number or expiry date of the Covid-19 vaccine as it was not included on the patient's vaccination paperwork. The event Tinnitus resulted in Physician Office visit. The outcome of reported events was not recovered. Follow-Up (11May2021): Upon follow up, new information included: Time of vaccine administration details, Anatomical site location details, lot details, Reported seriousness of the event Tinnitus details. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.

Close
At 1620, pt. received Pfizer vaccine administered by RN at clinic. Pt. was sent to observation area, which is in the cafeteria. At 1625, Support staff checked on pt. and pt. reported he felt dizzy and immediately informed RNs. Pt. was sitting on the chair and drinking water when this incident occurred. During assessment, pt. was found diaphoretic, pale in skin color, pt. reported blurry vision, and trouble breathing. Pt. respirations rate was 16 breaths per minute, non-labored, no signs of any distress. Pt. stated no prior medical history. After a few minutes, pt. started to recover. Pt. skin color started to improve and less diaphoretic. At 1629, EMS called by RN. Pt was moved to another area away from other patients. Pt. was able to ambulate, follow commands/ directions without any deficits. At 1637, EMS arrived, pt. vitals was taken BP=100/50's and stable. Pt. refused to go to the hospital for further observation. RN stayed with pt. until 1700. Pt. was given some snacks and drinks (gatorade and water). Pt. was moved across the nurses' vaccination table for further monitoring. Pt. fully recovered and left to go home at 1732.

Chest pain issues have resolved mostly. The most debilitating thing to come after the vaccine was the onset of ringing, buzzing persistently in left ear, comes and goes in right ear. Started 2 weeks and 2 days after second dose of Pfizer vaccine, and after flying multiple times and started when I got back on the 13th of April 2021. It has remained constant but has improved slightly from where it was in the beginning, have been doing Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy (five 1 hour sessions, spaced about a week-week and a half apart over the last 2 months to see if things improve). Things I would say have improved but I am running out of patience and financial means to keep going to a doctor. I feel helpless, depressional, work performance is awful, and lastly very suicidal than I have ever been. Just want to die.

24 2021-07-27 swelling of eyelid the bottom of the eyelid being swollen; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. Th... Read more
Close
the bottom of the eyelid being swollen; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. This consumer (parent- mother) reported for a patient (son). A 24-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Solution for injection, Batch/Lot Number: EW0185, Expiration date: UNKNOWN), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 18May2021, around 19:00 (at the age of 24-year-old) as dose 1, single for covid-19 immunisation. The patient Patient's Medical History(including any illness at time of vaccination was none. The patient was healthy. The concomitant medications were not reported. No additional vaccines administered on same date of the Pfizer suspect. Prior vaccinations (within 4 weeks) If applicable, list any other vaccinations within four weeks prior to the first administration date of the suspect vaccine(s) was provided as no. The Reporter reported that her son received the first injection of the Pfizer covid-19 vaccine on 18May2021, and later that day started experiencing the bottom of the eyelid being swollen. Maybe three or three and a half hours after receiving the first dose Pfizer COVID-19 Vaccine, the bottom eyelid swelled up: The Reporter states it is her son's bottom right eyelid, it was a little swollen, a little red in the corner and now it looks like her son got punched in the eye. The Reporter states her son's eyelid is not bruised, but it is swollen. Reports it has worsened since Tuesday night, 18MAY2021. The Reporter stated her son's eyelid was now more swollen and almost like where you get dark circles under your eyes. It looked similar to what it would look like if someone punched him in the eye. The Reporter was not sure if this was a reaction to the first dose Pfizer COVID19 Vaccine. The Reporter showed photos to an allergist, the allergist does not think it was from the Pfizer COVID-19 Vaccine but is not sure. The allergist told the Reporter to apply cold compresses on her son's eyelid and go from there. She was asking whether her son should receive the second Pfizer COVID-19 injection or not since he had this reaction after the first. Reporter seriousness for the event was unspecified. Adverse event did not required a visit to Emergency Room or Physician Office. Relevant tests performed was reported as none. The outcome of event was not recovered. Information on Lot/Batch number was available. Additional information has been requested. Follow-up attempts have been completed and no further information is expected.

25 2021-01-21 taste disorder, eye movement disorder, ear pain Bell's Palsy (left-sided) - diagnosed on 1/14/2021. Onset of symptoms on 1/11/2021 with altered tas... Read more
Close
Bell's Palsy (left-sided) - diagnosed on 1/14/2021. Onset of symptoms on 1/11/2021 with altered taste, earache. Progressed to left facial muscle weakness on 1/13/2021. Visited urgent care on 1/14/2021 where diagnosis was made. Received Prednisone 50mg for 5 days, Valacyclovir 1g TID for 7 days. Earache resolved. Facial weakness continued to worsen from 1/14 - 1/18 despite steroid treatment reaching minimal movement of left facial muscles, able to close left eye with difficulty. Left sided loss of taste still present. At follow-up appointment on 1/21/2021 with PCP, patient was prescribed additional steroid taper for 7 days.

Close
received the first dose of the vaccine on 30Dec2020 in a hospital. On 07Jan2021, he tested positive for COVID.; received the first dose of the vaccine on 30Dec2020 / On 07Jan2021, he tested positive for COVID / COVID symptoms; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable healthcare professional (patient) via a Pfizer-sponsored program. A 25-year-old male patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE; Solution for injection, lot number: EL1284, unknown lot number), intramuscular in left deltoid on 30Dec2020 at 19:30 at a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation/to prevent getting sick, to prevent the spread. Medical history and concomitant medication reported as none. The patient received the first dose of the vaccine on 30Dec2020 in a hospital. On 07Jan2021, he tested positive for COVID. His second dose is scheduled on 22Jan2021 and wants to know if he should get that or if there is any recommendation. The patient clarified that the COVID symptoms began on 06Jan2021. On the night of the 6th, he started to have chills and a headache throughout the night. He never had a fever or anything. He woke in the morning of 07Jan2021 kind of congested; runny nose, clear discharge. The patient wasn't able to taste his toothpaste, and then he couldn't smell his coffee. So, he experienced a loss of taste and smell. He was then tested for COVID (rapid test) on 07Jan2021 and tested positive. It was worse 2 days after he got sick. The patient progressively gotten better each day. The patient felt good today. He still can't taste or smell fully, some of it is coming back though. No additional vaccines administered on same date and no prior vaccinations within 4 weeks. The patient did not require a visit to emergency room/ physician office. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included COVID Rapid test: positive on 07Jan2021. The patient was recovering from the events chills, headache, "congested- runny nose, clear discharge", and Loss of taste and smell, while unknown outcome for the remaining events. The patient would consider the seriousness as not significant.; Sender's Comments: The efficacy of a drug varies from patient to patient and can be affected by different factors; however, a contributory role of the suspect product BNT162B2 to the reported drug ineffective and COVID-19 cannot be ruled out.

25 2021-03-03 vision blurred Within 1-2 minutes I experienced full body tingling; facial numbness; vision became distorted/blurry... Read more
Close
Within 1-2 minutes I experienced full body tingling; facial numbness; vision became distorted/blurry; vision became distorted/blurry; whole body was sweating; abdominal pain; lower extremity aching; nausea; experienced moderate to severe lower back spasms; sciatica; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable other health professional (patient). This 25-year-old male patient received the first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) (Lot# ELO739), via intramuscular on 04Feb2021 03:15 at single dose in the left arm for COVID-19 immunization. The patient's medical history included medullary kidney disease, and allergies to iodized contrast and bees (both resulting in anaphylaxis). The patient did not received any other medications within 2 weeks of vaccination. Facility where the most recent COVID-19 vaccine administered was Public Health Clinic/Veterans Administration facility. Patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Within 1-2 minutes (03:15) patient experienced full body tingling and facial numbness. A minute later his vision became distorted/blurry and he began getting warn. A minute later his whole body was sweating, he was experiencing abdominal pain, lower extremity aching, and nausea. These symptoms other than the sweating persisted for another 5 days. After the 5th day, patient experienced moderate to severe lower back spasms and sciatica that resulted in an urgent care visit and a prescription for muscle relaxers and a mild pain reliever. The muscle spasms have been present for a week now and is slowly getting better. Patient was seen by an orthopedic urgent care where they recommended physical therapy and limited walking/sitting for extended periods of time. The adverse event result in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit and Emergency room/department or urgent care. Treatment received for the adverse event included diphenhydramine hydrochloride (BENADRYL) (day of vaccination) and muscle relaxers. Prior to vaccination, patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, patient has not been tested for COVID-19. Outcome of whole body was sweating and sciatica was not recovered, outcome of moderate to severe lower back spasms was recovering, outcome of other events was recovered on an unspecified date in Feb2021. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.; Sender's Comments: Based on event-vaccine chronological association, a causal relationship between reported events and BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) cannot be excluded. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.

Gradual onset of altered taste 2/24/21. . On 2/27/21, he noticed that his right eye could not squint like his left. He was diagnosed with Bells Palsy by his PCP and started on Valacyclovir.

Close
No adverse reaction or allergic reaction in the 30 minutes following the vaccination. Also none in the 36 hours following the vaccination. Roughly 48 hours later, sensitivity to light and difficulty blinking one eye appeared along with severe headache. In the 24 hours following symptoms' first appearance, the entire left side of the face became numb and tingly with difficulty chewing, blinking, making any faces or smiling. Sound perceived from the left ear also changed. Subsequently diagnosed with Bell's Palsy on 03/10/2021.

About 5 minutes after getting the vaccine, patient started to have tunnel vision, loss of hearing, change in LOC unable to answer where he was, he was pale, diaphoretic and unable to respond to signals patient stated he was going to pass out he was removed from the chair and placed on the floor with his legs in the air, his pulse via palpation was slow, he stated that he does not like needles and he had a similar reaction to the H1n1 vaccine . He was placed on a back board and lifted to a litter and taken to the medical obs, vital signs on arrival were 134/75, pulse72 and oxygen 100 in the right arm, @ 1830 , and at 1834 vital 148/88 HR 75 pulse ox 99 on room air. patients skin was now warm and dry, he reported that he was feeling better, at 6:35 bp 133/81, patient was then placed in a sitting position and blood pressure with position change was :143/92, pulse 68 and 99% on room air, standing after 1 minute patient was 145/87 and heart rate 78 and pulse ox 99%. Patient reported feeling better. His color had returned, he was given water and monitored for another 5 minutes.

Patient received 1st dose of Pfizer Vaccine Lot#ER8730 and was sitting in chair at administering station when he lost consciousness. Patient regained consciousness, A/Ox4, skin pale, cold and clammy, pupils dilated. FNP assessed pupils were non reactive to light. Per FNP, patient then had a seizure for approx. 18 sec at 2:55 pm; seizure precautions maintained at all times. Upon regaining consciousness, pt. began projectile emesis. 911 called/patient brought to sick bay. BP 104/51, HR 120, O2 97%, Temp 97.1 Patient remained A/Ox4 and stated he felt "very tired." Patient came to the Walk in Vaccination clinic and stated he is an essential personal . After receiving his vaccine, patient reported feeling ?tingling in his throat? and feeling anxious. patient was taken by RN to our first aid area and asked to sit down. Patient denied shortness of breath or any other symptoms except tingling in his throat. Patient reported that he has no allergies to medications or foods but has a history of anxiety and stopped taking his medication 1 month ago. B/P was elevated 181/90, P 100 Pulse ox 100%, T 98.1. Patient refused an epi pen and asked to remain lying down so he could calm down . LVN Rechecked patient vitals in 15 min . Results were 124/88 , pulse ox 100%, T WNL. 25 2021-03-29 pupils dilated I administered the vaccine to Jake and he sat down. About two minutes later, he slumped in his chair... Read more
Close
I administered the vaccine to Jake and he sat down. About two minutes later, he slumped in his chair. My manager rushed to catch him from falling and I assisted in steadying him. He was breathing erratically, excessively diaphoretic, and his muscles were twitching frequently. His eyes were dilated and he became unresponsive. Fearing a seizure, we lowered him to the floor and turned him on his side. He became responsive and coherent again approximately one minute later and was speaking to us normally. Paramedics arrived several minutes later and took over care. He was taken to the hospital due to abnormal vital signs.

AT 5:35 PM PT CAME IN FOR HIS 2ND COVID SHOT. PT STATED THAT HE GOT HIS 1ST ONE DONE WITH NO ISSUES. AT 5:45 PM WHILE PT WAS WAITING FOR HIS WAITING PERIOD TO BE OVER, HE BECAME VERY PALE, EYES DILATED, UNRESPONSIVE, AND VERY SWEATY. I ASKED FOR ONE OF MY COWORKERS TO CALL 911, WHILE I GOT THE EMERGENCY KIT OVER TO THE PTS SIDE. AFTER ABOUT 30 SECONDS TO 1 MIN, PT CAME TO, AND WE GAVE HIM WATER AND A COLD CLOTH. WE GOT HIM ON HIS BACK, AND KNEES BENT, WHILE WE WAITED FOR EMS. I TOOK HIS PULSE WHILE WAITING FOR EMS AND DID NOT NOTE ANY BRADYCARDIA OR TACHYCARDIA. EMS TOOK OVER CARE AND FINISHED EXAMINATION IN THE TRUCK. HIS GIRLFRIEND WAS WITH HIM AND SAID SHE WOULD DRIVE HIM HOME.

Close
Temporary hearing loss; ringing of the ears; Extreme cold sweats; Blurred vision; This is a spontaneous report from a non-contactable consumer for a 25-years-old male patient received bnt162b2 (BNT162B2), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in right arm on 07Apr2021 14:00 (Batch/Lot Number: EP7533) as SINGLE DOSE for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included Covid-19 (Covid prior vaccination: Yes). Concomitant medications included sulfamethoxazole, trimethoprim. The patient previously took a tetanus booster on left arm. The patient had a Covid prior vaccination and not Covid tested post vaccination. On 07Apr2021 at 14:00, the patient experienced temporary hearing loss, ringing of the ears, extreme cold sweats, and blurred vision. The patient did not receive treatment for the events. The outcome of events was recovered on 07Apr2021. No follow up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.
25 2021-04-27 thirst On Wednesday April 14th I got my second vaccination shot. The following day I had a 103 F fever, bod... Read more
Close
On Wednesday April 14th I got my second vaccination shot. The following day I had a 103 F fever, body aches, chills, migraine, sore muscles, couldn't walk, excessive thirst. Those effects lasted all day and I felt better on Friday. Saturday night chest pain started along with sore arm getting worse. I took ibuprofen and melatonin to sleep. Woke up Sunday morning and pain came back and gradually got worse until I went into the ER around 9 am. They gave me Morphine to put the chest pain at bay. Then transferred me by ambulance to a different hospital with a cariology department. They treated me as if it was Myocarditis and also got an x-ray of my chest. The next morning I had an MRI and that is what confirmed it to be Myocarditis. I was then discharged with lots of medications to keep the inflammation down.
