Strong arm pain in the first evening after the vaccination (April 28) which caused poor sleep. Fever and chills start that night, along with excessive thirst. Arm pain alleviates first on the 29th, but fever lasts for the entire day, around 37.8C. Tiredness and light joint pain are also present. In the morning of April 30th, 48h after the vaccination, most symptoms are gone and only a light arm pain remains.

The patient was escorted to the waiting room post vaccine injection. He reported feeling light-headed. At 1220 while the NP was by his side, he became clammy, lost color, and became unresponsive with eyes rolled. He maintained his breathing and became conscious at 1225 with color returning and alert and oriented x 3. Pulse 65 BPM, O2 Sat 97-98% RA. He was escorted to the exam room table with the NP and PCT and placed in the supine position. He reports feeling light-headed and nauseous but alert and oriented x 3; BP 102/65, P 65 BPM, RR 16, O2 sat 97-98%. Notified at 1238. The patient was observed by the NP and remained with continuous pulse ox monitoring. At 1309, HOB raised to 30 degrees and patient given sips of water; BP 104/60, P 61 BPM, RR 16, O2 sat 97% RA. At 1323, HOB raised to 45 degrees. Patient c/o dizziness and nausea but tolerating sips of water; BP 110/75, P 63 BPM, RR 16, O2 sat 100% RA. At 1330, HOB raised to 90 degrees. Patient c/o dizziness and nausea, tolerating sips of water, BP 110/75, P 60 BPM, RR 16, O2 sat 98%. Patient escorted to waiting room chair at 1330 with NP and PCT. He c/o dizziness and nausea with position change, BP 110/75, P 60 BPM, RR 16, O2 sat 98% RA. He remains in the waiting room chair with PCT observation. At 1335, he begins with vomiting x 1 episode. He reports that he feels better and denies dizziness at this time. At 1353 he reports that he is feeling better. Denies dizziness or nausea; BP 104/60, P 65 BPM, RR 18, O2 sat 100% RA. He was discharged at 1410 with his boss from work. He is alert and oriented x 3, denies SOB, dizziness, lightheadedness, or N/V.

25 2021-05-20 swelling around the eyes, swollen tongue Pt reported an anaphylactic history to bee stings with his last reaction being in 2017 during his sc... Read more
Close
Pt reported an anaphylactic history to bee stings with his last reaction being in 2017 during his screening. Pt was instructed to wait an additional 30 minutes following his vaccination. Pt was given his vaccine at 1134. Pt reported a sensation of "tongue swelling and chest tightness" at 1139. Pt reported it felt like his past anaphylactic reaction. Pt voice sounded muffled, tongue appeared swollen. Pt self administered 1 adult Epi Pen at 1139 with x1 RN and x1 medic supervision. VS were taken. HR was 107, BP was 137/92, SpO2 was 97%. Lung sounds were clear in the apices and diminished in the bases bilaterally. Periorbital swelling was noted at 1140. 911 was called and an ambulance was dispatched at this time. The pt denied a feeling of nausea, denied dizziness. Pt was alert and oriented x4/4 for the entirety of observation. VS were taken again at 1144. The HR was 97, BP was 131/85, SpO2 was 97%. Last reported oral intake of a "bagel and coffee at 0800". VS taken again at 1147, HR 101, BP 135/86, SpO2 98%. Pt reported a continued feeling of throat tightness, periorbital swelling was increasing. Ambulance arrived at 1154 and was given full report. Paramedic assumed care at 1155. Paramedic team deemed it safe to administer one more dose of epinephrine and transport patient via ambulance to ER.

4/13: vaccine - Pfizer 4/14-4/15: arm sore 4/17: wake up in morning with calf twitching for prolonged period, went back to sleep 4/17-4/19: muscles in my body continue to twitch, mainly legs and arms 4/19: right eye begins to twitch 4/22: stopped drinking coffee and alcohol, began drinking much more water than normal to hydrate 4/27: drank alcohol for first time since I stopped Twitching has not subsided or become better or worse in this previous timeframes 4/28: right eye didnt twitch that much during the day 4/28: playing video games and getting frustrated caused the my eye and hand to twitch 4/29: had coffee for first time, eye twitch was worse than normal In the late afternoon (last time drinking coffee until today 5/26) 4/29: abs twitched for first time 5/1: left eye begins twitching 4/30-5/1: tingling in right hand pinky finger like hand is falling asleep 5/1-5/2: went to bar 5/3: sneezed and both eyes began twitching (I had sneezed before and this has happened, this is the first note I had written) 5/4: I went to my primary care doctor and shared these notes. Stopped taking notes since. Doctor had me take a blood test (see below) as well as referred to a neurologist for an EMG. 5/4-5/26: I've since been on some extra vitamins (b12 and d, as my b12 was on the low side but not outside the recommended range and d was also low) and have not seen any decrease or increase in symptoms. Some days are better than others. My right eye has stopped twitching, but I continue to have it throughout my body in my arms, back, legs, feet, left eye. I've been on an average diet since the beginning of march.

25 2021-05-26 swelling around the eyes, swollen tongue Pt reported an anaphylactic history to bee stings with his last reaction being in 2017 during his sc... Read more
Close
Pt reported an anaphylactic history to bee stings with his last reaction being in 2017 during his screening. Pt was instructed to wait an additional 30 minutes following his vaccination. Pt was given his vaccine at 1134. Pt reported a sensation of "tongue swelling and chest tightness" at 1139. Pt reported it felt like his past anaphylactic reaction. Pt voice sounded muffled, tongue appeared swollen. Pt self administered 1 adult Epi Pen at 1139 with x1 RN and x1 medic supervision. VS were taken. HR was 107, BP was 137/92, SpO2 was 97%. Lung sounds were clear in the apices and diminished in the bases bilaterally. Periorbital swelling was noted at 1140. 911 was called and an ambulance was dispatched at this time. The pt denied a feeling of nausea, denied dizziness. Pt was alert and oriented x4/4 for the entirety of observation. VS were taken again at 1144. The HR was 97, BP was 131/85, SpO2 was 97%. Last reported oral intake of a "bagel and coffee at 0800". VS taken again at 1147, HR 101, BP 135/86, SpO2 98%. Pt reported a continued feeling of throat tightness, periorbital swelling was increasing. Ambulance arrived at 1154 and was given full report. Paramedic assumed care at 1155. Paramedic team deemed it safe to administer one more dose of epinephrine and transport patient via ambulance to ER. In ER, patient endorses mild chest tightness but denies any shortness of breath, oral pharyngeal edema, difficulty swallowing, wheezing, abdominal discomfort, nausea or vomiting, pruritus, or hives. He was given Benadryl, methylprednisolone, and famotidine while in the emergency department to finish the allergic reaction cocktail. He was observed for a total of 3 hours after his last epi injection and he remained HDS and asymptomatic. He was given a prescription for EpiPen autoinjectors with multiple refills. Patient was advised that he should not receive his second covered vaccination without discussing with his PCM. He was given strict return precautions and patient felt comfortable being discharged home.

Close
25 year old Male with no significant PMH presented to the vaccination clinic for his first dose of the covid-19 vaccine. Patient recieved the dose at 6PM and around 6:10pm the nurse saw the Patients eyes roll back and began to shake all four extremities "jerky movements". Patient lost consciousness for about 15-30 seconds. Once Patient regained consciousness he began to say "What happened to me?". EMS was present and PA's. Patient reported that he had no symptoms prior to experiencing the seizure. Patient denies history of seizures, shortness of breath, chest pain, dizziness, blurry vision, abdominal pain, numbness/tingling, weakness and headache. Of note Patient has syncopized previously from blood draws. Patient was place on a 12 lead ekg: ekg unremarkable with no ST elevations, no inverted t waves, normal rate, intervals within normal intervals and no peaked t waves. Patients blood glucose was taken initially reading 54 and then Patient was given oral orange juice and the second blood glucose reading was 103. Patients initial vitals were HR: 62 RR:14, BP:117/82 with a SPO2: 100% on RA Second vital readings after 20mins there HR: 65 RR:15 BP:133/94 SPO2: 100% on RA. Patients physical exam revealed neurological exam within normal limits, Patient alert and oriented x4. Cranial nerves 2-12 intact, steady gait, ambulatory, normal finger to nose, no romberg, sensation intact in all fours extremities, all fours extremities reveal a strength of 5/5 and normal coordination. Patient was in no acute distress, alert and oriented. Cardiac exam: regular rate, rhythm, no rubs, murmurs, or gallops. Pulmonary: lungs clear bilaterally, no wheezing or rhonchi and airway patent. HEENT: Pupils equal round and reactive to light, EOM intact, airway patent, moist mucosa, no tongue lacerations, uvula mid-line. Patient was transported to the hospital via ambulance by Paramedic and EMT. Patients Mother was informed of what occurred at the vaccination site and was informed that her son was being transported to the hospital given Patients first seizure and no history of seizures.

Medical history and concomitant medications were none. It was stated that they have not had any other recent vaccinations or started any new medications. On 12Mar2021 the patient had tested positive for covid-19 and experienced loss of taste, and loss of smell. Reporter stated as he got the COVID-19 vaccine, his first shot a day before he tested positive for Covid, he would like to know if there is any possibility that it could have triggered a false positive for a COVID test. He said he just tested positive, and he had lost taste and smell. It was reported that the COVID test that was positive was a rapid test that (name) is doing, specific test name unknown. 25 2021-06-07 thirst, oropharyngeal discomfort throat fell really tight. They told him was throat was closing up.; Anaphylaxis/anaphylactic shock/s... Read more
Close
throat fell really tight. They told him was throat was closing up.; Anaphylaxis/anaphylactic shock/severe allergic reaction; Swelling of the throat/throat was swelling; Trouble breathing; Itchy throat; Said that his throat felt really thirsty.; He is very upset./He is pretty devastated.; His throat started to do it again.; They said maybe it was something he ate or maybe sinuses; This is spontaneous report from contactable consumer (patient) and contactable consumer (patient's mother). A 25-year-old male patient received the first dose for BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Lot No. EWO187) at single dose for COVID-19 immunization on 19May2021 at 12:00 or 13:00. Relevant history included Diabetes, obesity, endocrine abnormalities, genetic/chromosomal abnormalities, respiratory illness, compromised immune status and Allergies. The patient had Allergies to non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs that can induce anaphylactic shock, severe reaction, swelling of face and throat. Relevant concomitant drug was unknown. No history of all previous immunization with the Pfizer vaccine considered as suspect. No Additional Vaccines were Administered on Same Date of the Pfizer Suspect If applicable. No Vaccines were Administered prior vaccinations (within 4 weeks). Family Medical History was none. About 3-5 minutes after being administered the Vaccine, the patient immediately developed anaphylactic shock. He was transported via ambulance to the Emergency Room on 19May2021 where he verified he was admitted to the hospital Emergency room for about 5-6 hours and discharged from the hospital the same day, 19May2021. He was told not to get any additional doses. He was still having swelling of the throat and went back to the ER today and was given a steroid prednisone 40mg a day for 5 days. He was advised to take benadryl also. He said he didn't get any IVs or anything. He had a past medical history of anaphylactic reaction to NSAIDS. He has been advised not to get the second dose. The patient stated the anaphylactic shock occurred with trouble breathing, throat was swelling and itchy throat. He did go into ER, they told him to just keep drinking fluids, that there was nothing else they could really do. When he was seen in the emergency room they gave him Benadryl and a steroid: Prednisone for now which he is on for the next couple of days. He was told that after 2 days or something, that after getting injected that he wouldn't have any symptoms-but he is still having those pretty severe symptoms of anaphylactic shock. Initial onset of anaphylactic shock was about 3-5 minutes after Pfizer Covid Vaccine shot was administered. Within 10-15 minutes he had swelling of tongue and throat and difficulty breathing. They called an ambulance, the ambulance took him to the Hospital emergency room where he was admitted and discharged that same date on 19May2021 after about 5-6 hours; he reported discharge time was around 16:40. They told him to come back if he had any issues that occurred over next couple of days or worsening or causing problems; to call back the nurses line. He was on a lot of Benadryl, a lot of antihistamines. When he gets off the antihistamines almost all the allergic reactions of the anaphylactic shock reoccur. This morning, 21May2021, he didn't take any Bendaryl before bed, and this morning when he woke up he was alright. After being at work like 30 minutes he felt the itchiness; scratchy throat; swelling of tongue; a little swelling of the throat; difficulty breathing. He took Benadryl and called the hotline who told him to call the Emergency room, he called the emergency room and went there. He talked to them this morning because he went to work and had issues breathing. He called and they told him to come in asap, so he went in to the emergency room; they gave him Benadryl and told him there was nothing else they could do other than him taking the steroid: Prednisone. The patient was in the hospital 3 days and will be day 4 tomorrow. He was trying to figure out how long this will last. They told him to talk to his doctor. They basically told him they were not responsible. The patient's mother reported that her son received the shot Wed 19May2021. Does not know if the Walgreen's reported this. He left there in an ambulance within 10 minutes of getting the shot. They took him to the emergency room and he got mixed information. He went back again today. They blew him off and told him maybe it was something he ate. She assumed that an allergic reaction would be about 24 hours but this is day 3. She is scared he may be taking too much Benadryl. He said he felt like he needed something to drink. Said that his throat felt really thirsty. He went back inside since his throat fell really tight. They told him was throat was closing up. They saw that his throat was swollen and they called the paramedics. Within 15 minutes they came and brought him to the emergency room. Nobody had given him Epi. They were going to give it to him an Epi pen but he wanted to wait for the paramedics. He was freaking out. The paramedics showed up and they were unable to give him Epi, stating he didn't have hives. He only received Benadryl. They he had to have to give him extra Benadryl because whatever they gave him in the IV because the first didn't work and his throat was still closing up. It made him feel like a drug addict asking for Benadryl. She was not sure if they gave him Benadryl in the ambulance, knows that it was given in the emergency room. The Benadryl may have been started in the ambulance but she is not sure. They did give him oxygen in the ambulance. Clarified he was in the ER over 4 hours, but was not admitted to the hospital. They gave him steroids but forgot to send him home with steroids. He had to call to find out about getting them and they told him they forgot to send the prescription in. He was late starting the next dose of steroids. He went back to the ER today, day 3. He didn't feel too bad today and went to work. After exerting a little energy and moving around, his throat started to do it again. He didn't have Benadryl on him. He left work because he thought it was going to close up again the day he got the shot. Once he calmed down, he took Benadryl. He called the hospital to ask if this was normal. He was told that it is not normal and was told that if he still felt bad, to come to the hospital. They said maybe it was something he ate or maybe sinuses. He spoke to one of the doctors. They had never shown him how to use an ePi pen. He does not know how long this will last. He gets scared. Treatment: Has only been taking Benadryl. He started the steroids yesterday and today. They had given him Benadryl today in the ER and he is home now. The patient visited to the Emergency room twice, first time by ambulance, confirmed he was not admitted. He was pretty devastated. The outcome of events was unknown.

Close
Patient received the 2nd COVID vaccine (Pfizer, lot # ER8736, use by 07/04/21) at 0950. The client told EMT, " am feeling a little light-headed and dizzy" at 1000. The client was immediately assisted to the anti-gravity chair and placed in a semi-fowler's position. The client appeared mildly diaphoretic. RN arrived on scene and assessed the client who was A & O x 4. The client was offered Benadryl and stated, " I think I will hold off on Benadryl and see how I feel in a few minutes." Vital signs were taken at 1003, BP- 132/84, HR-74, RR-14, oxygen saturation- 98%. The client was given juice and a granola bar. The client no longer appeared diaphoretic, denied feeling flushed, itchy, shortness of breath, difficulty breathing, angioedema, or chest pain. The client is currently taking Turmeric, denied any chronic medical conditions, or drug allergies. Vital signs taken at 1008, BP- 138/84, HR- 69, RR-14, oxygen saturation at 98%. The client stated, " I'm feeling better and the light-headedness is better." Vital signs taken at 1013, BP- 139/88, HR- 69, RR-14, oxygen saturation- 99%. The client was assisted to a Fowler's position by EMT. Vital signs taken at 1015, BP- 136/86, HR- 69, RR-14, oxygen saturation-98%. Patient stated " I'm just feeling tired", denied shortness of breath, difficulty swallowing, itching or swelling. Vital signs taken again at 1025 BP- 141/86, HR-66, RR-14, oxygen saturation 99%. Client stated, " The light-headedness and dizziness is gone, my mouth is just a little dry." The patient then drank water which relieved the mouth dryness. Last vitals taken at 1030 BP-139/82, HR-66, RR-14, oxygen saturation 99%. The client slowly stood up and denied any dizziness, headache, SOB, or chest pain. RN educated the client about follow-up precautions with his PCP, Emergency Room precautions, and educated the client about V-safe. The client had a steady and even gait when walking to his vehicle at 1034.

25 2021-06-13 double vision Immediate reaction of arms tingling and nausea/vomiting. Basic vaccine symptoms the first week incl... Read more
Close
Immediate reaction of arms tingling and nausea/vomiting. Basic vaccine symptoms the first week including headache, nausea, fever. After about a week, COVID fog/fatigue symptoms began. It is currently 6 weeks later and I have fatigue, shortness of breath, head pressure, double vision, cannot concentrate for any length of time and dizziness/unsteadiness. I have not been able to go to work since the vaccination and have people helping take care of me. I cannot take a shower without being short of breath after. I have been put on 2 different rounds of steroids ? the 2nd more aggressive, which did not make a difference. I have been to my general doctor several times, an allergist and a neurologist. I have had extensive bloodwork, an MRI, and an EKG ? all were normal. My symptoms have not improved at all in the past 3-4 weeks.
25 2021-06-13 vision blurred At 3:48 patient began to feel light headed, had hot flashes, and blurry vision. No injuries occurred... Read more
Close
At 3:48 patient began to feel light headed, had hot flashes, and blurry vision. No injuries occurred at time of adverse event.
25 2021-06-21 vision blurred Patient started sweating, blood pressure dropped, blurry vision, and was shaking. We gave him water ... Read more
Close
Patient started sweating, blood pressure dropped, blurry vision, and was shaking. We gave him water and a snack and he stated that he felt better.
25 2021-06-23 hearing loss Over a month after receiving my second dose of Pfizer, I had an episode of lightheadedness, dizzines... Read more
Close
Over a month after receiving my second dose of Pfizer, I had an episode of lightheadedness, dizziness, shakiness, and fatigue. I attributed it to dehydration and laid down and ate a snack, I began to feel better after 1-2 hours. A week later I had another lightheadedness incident that sent me back to bed (this one being slightly worse). I experience slight chest pain in my upper right chest muscle. It took me a day to recover from this spell. I constantly felt weak and as if I was about to faint. I went to the doctor two days later and got blood work done and measured my blood pressure. Everything came back normal. On Saturday June 19th, I had another near-fainting experience in a public setting. My hearing changed, I couldn't think straight, I was very shaky and weak, and I tried to drink a lot of water. Nothing helped so I went home and once I got in bed I was aggressively shaking. Since then I have been bed-ridden for the week, and unable to do normal activities such as go for walks, exercise, or go to work. I am going to visit a cardiologist tomorrow.
25 2021-06-23 vision blurred Client received Pfizer vaccine at 1502 without any complications/client anxiety. Client was lead to ... Read more
Close
Client received Pfizer vaccine at 1502 without any complications/client anxiety. Client was lead to lobby for CDC recommended 15 minutes of observation. At 1508, the client fell sideways in his chair but caught himself. Client reported having hazy vision for a second. Client's skin was pale and highly diaphoretic. Client then passed out for 20 seconds. Clinic RN grabbed under his armpits to hold him in chair to prevent him from falling over. Once client regained consciousness, (1510: BP 100/85, HR 60) Client was moved to the vaccination room to lie down on the floor with his feet elevated above his heart with a chair. BP taken at 1512, 110/80. Client given 4 cups cold water to drink and 3 fun sized candy bars to eat. At 1520 BP was 110/70, HR 70. Client monitored and assisted to chair. Ten minutes in chair he was allowed to try standing. Client was able to ambulate on own without assistance. Client was monitored for 45 minutes post vaccination, no obvious signs of distress, pruritus, apnea, hives/rashes, heart palpitations. Instructed to place family member on speaker phone while driving home/ leaving clinic.
25 2021-06-25 vision blurred, double vision Immediate reaction of arms tingling; Nausea; Vomiting; Headache; Fever; Fatigue; Shortness of breath... Read more
Close
Immediate reaction of arms tingling; Nausea; Vomiting; Headache; Fever; Fatigue; Shortness of breath; Head pressure; Double vision; Cannot concentrate for any length of time; Dizziness; Unsteadiness; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer or other non hcp. This consumer (patient) reported for himself that a 25-years-old male patient received bnt162b2 (BNT162B2, Formulation: Solution for injection, Batch/Lot number: EW0171), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Right on 02May2021 12:00 (Age at vaccination: 25) as DOSE 1, SINGLE for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included seasonal allergy. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The patient previously took erythromycin and sulfa. On 02May2021 12:00, the patient experienced Immediate reaction of arms tingling; Nausea; Vomiting; Headache; Fever; Fatigue; Shortness of breath; Head pressure; Double vision; Cannot concentrate for any length of time; Dizziness and Unsteadiness . Patient was received steroids as treatment for events. No hospitalization prolonged. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included blood test: normal on, electrocardiogram: normal on, magnetic resonance imaging: normal on, sars-cov-2 test: negative on 06May2021, sars-cov-2 test: negative on 19May2021. It was reported that patient had basic vaccine symptoms the first week including headache, nausea, fever. After a week, COVID fog/fatigue symptoms began. It is currently 6 weeks later and patient had fatigue, shortness of breath, head pressure, double vision, cannot concentrate for any length of time and dizziness/unsteadiness. I have not been able to go to work since the vaccine and have people helping take care of me. I cannot take a shower without being short of breath. I have been put on 2 different rounds of steroids - the 2nd more aggressive, which did not make a difference. I have been to my general doctor several times, an allergist and a neurologist. I had no previous health problems. Symptoms had not improved in the past 3-4 weeks. Patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Prior to vaccination, patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, patient has been not tested for COVID-19. The clinical outcome of all events were not recovered. Follow-up attempts are needed. Further information is requested.
25 2021-06-26 vision blurred Symptoms include: chest pain, lightheadedness, headaches, blurry vision, difficulty focusing vision.... Read more
Close
Symptoms include: chest pain, lightheadedness, headaches, blurry vision, difficulty focusing vision. The only treatment I've received is I was prescribed Hydroxyzine as a sleep aid. Outcome: Still hindered by symptoms 2 months after both vaccine shots
25 2021-07-10 visual impairment blood in urine, neck stiffness, headache in back of head, stabbing headache, temporal pressure, visu... Read more

blood in urine, neck stiffness, headache in back of head, stabbing headache, temporal pressure, visual disturbances,
25 2021-07-25 eye movement disorder 5 minutes after vaccine was received, the patient's eyes rolled back and he fell off his chair. his ... Read more
Close
5 minutes after vaccine was received, the patient's eyes rolled back and he fell off his chair. his body stiffened up and he seized. We called the ambulance and they arrived shortly after. Water was given and back support was provided until the EMT and the patient's mother arrived.
25 2021-07-28 eye movement disorder Patient had what appeared to be a seizure within 5 minutes of receiving vaccination. Per sister-in... Read more
Close
Patient had what appeared to be a seizure within 5 minutes of receiving vaccination. Per sister-in-law: he has a history of "fainting" with shots, but to me, it did not appear as a "fainting" episode since he became rigid and his eyes rolled back while he remained seated. 9-1-1 emergency services was called and patient was taken to the local E.R.
